84502.name: Juggernaut
84502.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the juggernaut, a prestige class ideal for barbarians and fighters, but also suitable for other martial characters. Juggernauts are warriors with a visceral need to plow through opponents. Their sheer physical strength allows them to charge or overrun their foes in any situation, and their great resolve makes them unstoppable.

84503.description:
(based on GMT website description, italicized text is additional:)

This Expansion Set for The Battle for Normandy allows players to extend the campaign game to the end of August, but most importantly includes the area for the Mortain and Falaise Pocket scenarios.
Counters are included to fill out Allied and Axis Order of Battles to the end of August, and also include specific breakdown counters for AT, SP AT, and mechanized infantry.
The Full Color Rules & Scenario books are updated and comprehensive, and include all original rules and scenarios plus all optional rules, and 6 new scenarios.
Components:

1 Rulebook (color): Original rules plus updates and all addtional optional rules (40 pages - dated 2013)
1 Scenario book (color): Originals plus 6 additional including Falaise Gap, Mortain and Operation Totalize - 12 scenarios in total (64 pages- dated 2013).
Two full maps; the top halves of which will overlap Maps D & E, taking it just over a half map South. These will be back-printed with mid-map projections for scenarios
map ABC on one side / map G on other side
map CE on one side / map F on other side

1 8-1/2 x 11" color map section: (Utah Beach area) cardstock
2 full countersheets (560 counters) - [...] counters to fill out the OOB to the end of August, optional type-specific breakdown counters (AT, SP AT, mech infantry, etc.) and replacements counters
4 new German infantry divisions, 1 US infantry division, 1 US armored division, German coastal batteries Fire arc limited, Marker counters for optional rules (Weather forecast, Commando REM repl, CW/US air & supply allocation planning), errata counters (including counters published in C3I #24)
Princess Irene Brigade & the Belgian brigade, "Tac Move" & "Isolated" markers, etc...
84503.name: The Battle for Normandy Expansion
boardgameexpansion: The Battle for Normandy

84504.name: Owl Prowler
84504.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the owl prowler, a prestige class ideal for rangers, but also suitable for other martial and roguish characters. Owl prowlers hide in the shadows and rely on their acute senses to strike fatal blows at unsuspecting foes. They understand that brute force is useless and that intuition is the key to survival.

84505.name: Prana Filcher
84505.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the prana filcher, a core class combining good combat capabilities with supernatural powers. Prana filchers are masters of the ancient art of prana manipulation. While they can maintain and restore the health of their allies, prana filchers excel at forcefully draining the life force of their enemies, thus causing them all sorts of pathological symptoms in the midst of battle.

84506.name: Shamanistic Warrior
84506.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the shamanistic warrior, a core class designed to be a combatant with numerous tactical options in combat. Shamanistic warriors know how to call forth all sorts of animal powers to aid them in battle as well as in other physical challenges. Their great flexibility, overall combat prowess, and link to the world of nature spirits make them quintessential warriors of the wild.

84507.name: Snake
84507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the snake, a prestige class with requirements and abilities flexible enough to suit any combat-oriented character. Snakes are cunning and vicious warriors who have mastered the art of hypnotism. Their serpent-like stance and reflexes allow them to strike with surgical precision, causing frequent and deadly critical hits.

84508.name: Wildcat
84508.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the wildcat, a prestige class ideal for fighters and barbarians, but also suitable for other martial characters. Wildcats are all about speed. They strike with alarming quickness and can surprise even the best-prepared foes. Like felines, these agile warriors never waste an opportunity to kill.

84509.name: Wolfpack Hunter
84509.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warriors of the Wild is a fantasy d20 product line designed for both players and game masters. It offers well-balanced and thoroughly play-tested classes constructed around various animal, natural, and tribal themes. These classes are perfect for any combat-heavy game, be it in dungeons, cities, the wilderness, or other planes.

This product features the wolfpack hunter, a prestige class ideal for rangers, but also suitable for any character with an animal companion. Together with his mystically empowered wolf companion, the wolfpack hunter leads his pack of wolves into battle and relentlessly hunts his preys.

84510.name: Treasure of Unicorn Gold
84510.description:
User Comment:

This is #6 in the Metagaming Microquests series. Like Treasure of the Silver Dragon, it is a programmed adventure for Melee and Wizard (or the Advanced versions), which also included a real-world treasure hunt. Along with the game booklet, the box contains an 8 x 13 map, a counter sheet (which you must cut apart), and a die.

From the back of the box:

"The $10,000 quest continues....

Etherion, the great silver Dragonodon, is frozen in stasis under Sacremento Peak -- victim of the Toltec Brujos. Yet man's hope lives through Miri the True and Golden Xenon. Can your band of hearty heroes help them before cruel Yaoyotl strikes? Can you find the secret treasure of Unicorn Gold?

A Unicorn is hidden somewhere in the U.S.A. The clues to its location are hidden in this adventure. The person who finds it gets a $10,000 cash prize from Metagaming. This isn't play, it's a real live treasure hunt. You may be the one to decipher the clues, find the Unicorn, and win the treasure."

84511.name: Demolition Simulator
84511.description:
Take control of an emerging demolition company in a large city. A multitude of missions lead you to various demolition sites in different districts of the city. Take a seat behind the steering wheel of a variety of detailed construction and demolition machines. Bring old buildings to the ground with wrecking balls and excavators. Place explosive charges or tear down walls manually with the jackhammer. You can invest the earned money in new vehicles which in turn unlock new assignments in the city and tutorials in your company's practice area.

Source: The Game Website.

Features
o 4 detailed levels
o Realistic physics
o 12 challenging missions with varied tasks
o Various demolition techniques: Demolition Machinery, wrecking ball, blasting, etc.
o Use construction vehicles such as bulldozers and loaders to transport the rubble
o Editor included so you can create your own building to demolish
o Optional control by gamepad / joystick possible

Source: The Publisher Website.

84512.name: Savage 007
84512.description:
Author's Description:

The Victory Games Inc. role playing game did a great job depicting the James Bond world. But, when Pinnacle released Savage Worlds, I became a fan right away and I knew I had to come up with a James Bond conversion, which of course I'm calling Savage 007! It's not only "Fast! Furious! Fun!," it's, "Savaged, Not Stirred!"

84513.name: Hammerin' Harry
84513.description:
User Summary

Hammerin' Harry (Daiku no Gen-san) is the first entry in the series of the same name. It is an arcade game by Irem about a man whose house is destroyed by the evil construction company Rusty Nailers Inc. that seeks revenge. He goes forth with his only possession ... a giant wooden hammer!

The game was ported to the Famicom (and PAL NES), but the North American release was cancelled. Some minor level and boss changes were made, but the graphics were significantly worse and the physics based object+hammer collisions were basically removed.

84514.name: Monty Python's Really Silly Board Game
84514.description:
If you’re a fan of Monty Python or just plain silly, then this Really Silly Board Game will have you laughing like Ernest Scribbler as you travel the board collecting Spam. Test your knowledge of Monty Python TV and movie trivia, undertake silly challenges and explore the wickedly funny world of Monty Python.

- A board game for adults combining Monty Python trivia, charades, impressions and silly behaviour
- Features 6 characters: Gumby, Knight of Ni, Spanish Inquisitor, Mr Creosote, Lumberjack & Brian of Nazareth
- Trade Spam pieces for Quest items and complete your quest to win the game
- 400 silly questions and hilarious tasks such as ‘Who’s got the funniest silly walk?'
- An ideal break from the usual Christmas ‘bored’ game!

84515.name: Chronicles of Anyaka: Let Sleeping Dragons Lie
84515.description:
From Introduction:

This module is the fourth in the "Chronicles of Anyaka" series of modules. They are written so that they can be used as single adventures dropped into your campaign or as a series of modules that can take characters from the beginning of their career all the way to legendary status. This fourth module finds the characters gaining knowledge of the events that surrounded Anyaka's kidnapping as well as a new threat that has seemingly popped up overnight. In the wake of Anyaka's successful return, her mentor, the
paladin Aurelius, sends a thankful note to the PCs. He also warns them of a new threat centered in the coastal city of Bluffside, one that seems to have arisen as a direct result of their successes in the caverns beneath Eston Manor. By the end of the adventure, the PCs should find themselves in possession of an important key to stopping the Cult of Shandrulaar as well as the burden of a frightening glimpse of the future that could be.

"Let Sleeping Dragons Lie" is a d20 fantasy adventure suitable for four characters of 8th level. This adventure requires the PCs to do a fair amount of investigation in between bouts of combat, so characters with Charisma-based skills will be useful to the party. A rogue who knows the inner workings of thieves' guilds might come in handy, as might a cleric when the characters descend into the crypts to face the undead horrors therein.

84516.name: Foul Deeds Rise
84516.description:
From Introduction:

The PCs are thrown into this adventure when their travels in the earldom of Oswick are noticed by the current lord, Morvekai Oswick. Morvekai sees the presence of brave adventurers in his lands as a fine excuse to throw a party, and invites the characters to his castle as guests of honor at a grand banquet. During the feast, the ghost of Ralnon Oswick appears, groaning in low tones, moving slowly and silently across the stone floor. The party degenerates into panicked chaos, and Morvekai begs the PCs to stay on and solve the mystery of the ghost's appearance.

The characters may be of any race or class, though a dwarf would be particularly appropriate and a cleric with the ability to channel positive energy would be extremely helpful. "Foul Deeds Rise" can be easily integrated into any campaign.

84517.name: Ice Mithril Bay
84517.description:
From Introduction:

As the characters sail through the frozen northern reaches of the world they must navigate the Chatwa Archipelago. Hidden within is the secret island of the Ice Mithral dwarves. Either through design or providence the party will eventually be forced to explore this island. Encountering both pirates and the former dwarves, now undead guardians of the secrets of Ice Mithral.

The characters may be of any race or class, though dwarven characters might derive particular enjoyment from this adventure.

84518.name: Legacy of Horrors
84518.description:
From Introduction:

The adventure revolves around the legacy of Delgar, a wizard responsible for many bizarre experiments, chief among them the creation of "horrors." These horrors plagued the region unchecked
until a stalwart band of adventurers put an end to his madness. As the years rolled by Delgar was forgotten, the legacy of his horrors all but obliterated, until now.

"Legacy of Horrors" is a D20 System adventure designed for 7th to 13th level characters, automatically scaled to fit a DM's campaign setting by the Xenogenic Publishing System™. The adventure can easily be placed in any campaign world (preferably in an arid setting) and provides opportunities for every core
character class to shine. The adventure works equally well with characters with questionable motivations.

84519.name: Harlem Globetrotters
84519.description:
Harlem Globetrotters is an NES sports game about a basketball team who does tricks in order to impress basketball fans. Unlike most other basketball video games, there is only an exhibition mode in this game where the player can play as either the Harlem Globetrotters or their rivals. The player can even pull down the referee's pants or trip the ref when a free throw has been called when playing as the Harlem Globetrotters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harlem Globetrotters (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84520.name: Treasure Hunters: Crypt of the Beast Lord
84520.description:
From Introduction:

This module is the first in the Treasure Hunters series of modules. They are written so that they can be used as single adventures dropped into your campaign or as the backbone for a Treasure Hunters' campaign. This first module, "Crypt of the Beast Lord," introduces the Treasure Hunters' Guild and background information that will be relevant during the ongoing campaign. Information and equipment gained from this adventure could prove useful in future modules and in the ongoing war against evil.

This adventure was originally intended for four 3rd level characters, of any good alignment. While having a priest or paladin is not required to play this adventure, both classes would bring added security with their ability to turn undead. A rogue would also be helpful to disarm the numerous traps placed in the dungeon.

84521.name: Chains of Shadow
84521.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ghosts are not content to lurk in the shadows as mere haunts and corrupters. They peer deep into a twilight world, one that conceals mysteries and powers beyond the knowledge or ability of the corporeal.

Chains of Shadow provides eighteen new feats specifically designed for such ghosts; those who desire to dwell between light and dark, take and shape the shadows around them, and master umbral powers of both creation and destruction.

84522.name: Chains of the Phantom
84522.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ghosts prefer deceit over destruction, control over corruption. Their power lies in the strength of their mind, though not over matter. They view telekinesis as a mere parlour trick, a wild talent fit only for barbarians accustomed to throwing and breaking things. Instead, they use their power to affect the minds of others, altering the perception of reality itself to mislead and influence.

Chains of the Phantom provides eighteen new feats specifically designed for such ghosts; those who desire to beguile the mind, deceive the senses, and wield hallucination like a fine blade.

84523.name: Chains of the Spirit
84523.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ghosts spend their afterlife in quiet meditation instead of mischief and malevolence. They study spirituality from a unique perspective, pursuing a deeper understanding of their own nature and a heightened awareness of the cosmos around them.

Chains of the Spirit provides nineteen new feats specifically designed for such ghosts; those who desire to transcend their remaining ties to the material world, expand their conscious minds, and seek enlightenment.

84524.name: Shroud of the Aether
84524.description:
From publisher blurb:

The death of a character. These words strike dread into players and DMs alike. At best, the party has a cleric with raise dead prepared, and the game can continue. At worst, the player is sidelined for the rest of the adventure, until the party can return to town. But what if there were some way to keep the character in the game and the player involved? What if... she became a ghost?

The problem, of course, is that the ghost template grants a sudden and major increase in ability. Pretty quickly, everyone will want to be one. And what if they decide that they'd rather remain ghosts? Where do they go from there?

Introducing Shroud of the Aether. Undeath, with class!

A casualty class is like a prestige class, in that you must meet certain requirements before you can take a level in one. In this case, the prime requirement is that your character is dead. Snuffed out, answered the final summons, shuffled off this mortal coil, crossed over, and joined the choir invisible. But you have plans other than resting in peace...

Casualty classes allow your character to continue on, whether in a new, permanent state of existence or just until they?re magically raised or reincarnated. They combine the features and abilities of an undead template with hit dice and attack and save bonus progression to make those abilities effectively available, in part or in whole, to any character or creature.

Shroud of the Aether includes...

The ghost casualty class.
Twelve general ghost feats, from Corpse Candle to Written in Blood.
Thirteen feats in Chains of the Aether, from Apport to Swift Manifestation.
Eight feats in Chains of the Banshee, from Banshee Keen to Haunting Moan.
Sixteen feats in Chains of the Coil, from Animate Weapon to Violent Telekinesis.
Twelve feats in Chains of Corruption, from Corrupting Form to Withering Touch.
Nine feats in Chains of Dread, from Baneful Aura to Widen Dread.
Eleven feats in Chains of Malevolence, from Chronic Malevolence to Remote Malevolence.
Four-page glossary of relevant information from the SRD for easy reference.

84525.description: In the game, up to six bears try to create a store of honey. On the field, around a meadow, are six bear caves. In the middle of the meadow there are the bees. Every player has a choice to move the bears or the bees.The bears move exactly four steps, and if they cross one, they can lift honey pots, which they try as quickly as possible to transport to their caves. When moving the bee you roll a special die (2x honey symbol 3,4,5,6). The honey bee is then moved to a space and on their old space is a honey pot is laid. The bees can also chase the bears, if caught the affected bears lose the honey and start again in the cave. Honey which is already in the cave is safe. The winner is the bear who has a full stock (adjusted according to players) collected first.
84525.name: Honigbär und Stachelbiene

84526.name: The Scientist' Sourcebook
84526.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Scientist...now see what else you can do with the Scientist. The Scientist's Sourcebook features eight new sub-classes, it also introduces you to an easy to use research system, and it features new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the scientist class.

84527.name: The Law Enforcer's Sourcebook
84527.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Law Enforcer...now see what else you can do with the Law Enforcer. The Law Enforcer's Sourcebook features nine new sub-classes, and it features new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the law enforcer class.

84528.name: The Soldier's Sourcebook
84528.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Soldier/Mercenary...now see what else you can do with the Soldier/Mercenary. The Soldier's Sorucebook features eight new sub-classes, it also introduces you to Mercenary Guilds, and it features new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the Soldier/Mercenary class.

84529.name: The Trader's Sourcebook
84529.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Trader...now see what else you can do with the Trader. The Trader's Sorucebook features six new sub-classes, it also introduces you to the interstellar Trade Guilds, and it features new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the Trader class.

84530.name: The Ephemeris Species Compendium
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
84530.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Previously released as six seperate species sourcebooks, The Ephemeris Species Compendium combines all of the material from those sourcebooks into one title.

You'll find more information on what makes each of the species tick, including new species specific sub-classes, new skills and abilities, and new goods for your character to use.

This supplement contains the following sourcebooks: The Althani Sourcebook, The Arbonix Sourcebook, The Culthan Sourcebook, The Human Sourcebook, The Melanathee Sourcebook, and the Tulmath Sourcebook.

84531.description: "Hello Mr. Bear" is part of the Haba series "From 2 years," an infants-game series from Haba. The game is several games within a game. The game has no board but rather it is made up of a house that can be built up, it has three walls and an open side, and several wooden figures that can be positioned within the house. The first game supports listening and understanding of words and figures and the fine motor skills. Other games are simple memory games where the children try to remember which figures have been placed in the house.
84531.name: Hallo Herr Bär

84532.name: Aces High
84532.description:
From the introduction:
I’ve loved Crimson Skies ever since I saw the box on the table at FASA’s booth during Gen Con. I scratched together every supplement and guard them jealously. I still play the original PC game when I have time to myself. I own every set of the WizKids CMG version. These rules initially started out as a bridge between that faster version and the original boxed version. The board game is fun but it’s not light by any stretch of the imagination. I’ve always wanted a Crimson Skies RPG to be released but it seems like that’s not in the cards.

When I first read through Savage Worlds I thought to myself. "Finally I can run my Crimson Skies RPG!" the rules were light, the tone was pulpy, and the combat lived up to its slogan of "Fast! Furious! Fun!" I discovered www.savageheroes.com and wanted to do a more comprehensive conversion than the one originally found there. To play this game you will need the Savage Worlds Core Rules available at www.peginc.com. The Savage Worlds Adventure Deck is also recommended for that extra pulpy flavor. Many of the Edges and Hindrances were adapted from the fine game available for this system also available at the website. I also encourage you to track down any Crimson Skies memorabilia that you can. The main box set has rules to create planes that you can then convert to this system. Other books have planes that can be converted as well.

84533.name: Savage Adventure!
84533.description:
Web Blurb:
A conversion of the two-fisted pulp game Adventure! to Savage Worlds. It really is mostly Necessary Evil stuff converted into the framework of Adventure!

From the introduction (sic):
Well, that’s it. This is what I used to run my own Adventure!-Style pulp game. The only thing which I never really dealt with here was the Adventure! game’s dramatic editing system. To my way of thinking, that’s what bennies are for anyway, right? Have fun, and if you haven’t already done it, run right out and get the following books:

ADVENTURE! the pulp-prg - This is the best pulp game made yet! I just haven’t liked the systems it was coupled with. Now that I’ve got it jiving with Savage Worlds, the world is a better place! The background and fluff in this book are amazing! Warren Ellis has even done an ADVENTURE! story! If you want to crank up the timeline and play in ADVENTURE’s slightly post-modern future, pick up a copy of the Aberrant rpg, and it’s suppliments.

Savage Worlds core book - Best system ever! Period. The new book is in pdf format and the original can still be found here and there. Go to Great White Games or Pinnacle’s websites to get this game!

Neccissary Evil - The first Savage Worlds Super hero (?) setting and what they’ve done is great! If you want to link Neccissary Evil up with Adventure! instead of Aberrant, you can DO it! It works great! Maybe even have PCs stumble across evidence of the Atlanteans!

84534.name: Savage Babylon 5
84534.description:
User Summary:
A web-published conversion of Babylon 5 to the Savage Worlds system. Provides racial information, new edges and hindrances, powers and spaceships.

84536.name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
84536.description:
Home Alone 2: Lost In New York is a video game based on the 1992 movie Home Alone 2: Lost in New York, it was released on the NES, Sega Genesis, Game Boy, MS-DOS and Super NES systems. Though it is based on the movie in terms of plotline and additional dialogue, the game was different from the movie. The NES port uses sound effects from the early 1990's Simpsons games; Bart vs. the Space Mutants for example.

Certain changes made the game more interesting in an interactive game than in a static movie, such as use of different weapons and power-ups for protection, level layouts with enemies not seen in the movie, and for the Uncle's House level, usage of hidden keys and locked doors gained only after luring Marv or Harry into specific traps laid out in the various rooms (aka the first two Home Alone movies), as well as an active scene involving the Bird Woman and her birdseed attacks.

The Super NES version, while boasting a soundtrack with the Super NES traditionally realistic sounding instrument synth, suffered due to slightly post-8-bit graphics and sound effects, as well as a disjointed feel of incontinuity between stages.

The NES version has four different levels, the first of which is the Plaza Hotel. Kevin races through various floors and rooms collecting power-ups and avoiding the hotel staff, crazy guests and runaway vacuum cleaners and suitcases. Before he can escape, however, he has to deal with two bosses: the ever-persistent House Detective and the Master Chef. The next level takes place in Central Park, and is similar to the Plaza Hotel: Kevin collects his goodies while avoiding rats, bats and assorted thugs.

The third level takes place in Kevin's uncle's three-story Townhouse. This time Kevin has to avoid Harry and Marv, and sets up several booby-traps to keep the Wet, er, Sticky Bandits at bay. While doing so, Kevin must also find keys that will allow him to escape to the next floor, and ultimately the Rooftop. Once he's on the roof, Kevin escapes to the streets of New York with the Bandits hot on his tail, until he reaches the giant Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center. It's here where he gets help from the Pigeon Lady to defeat Harry and Marv, have them sent to jail, and finally reunites with his family.

Reception

The game has had very low critical reception. Most reviewers complain that various elements of the game change depending on what part of a level the player is on; for example, the slide attack is an effective move on one part of the level, but does not work on another.

Home Alone 2: Lost in New York was awarded Worst Sequel of 1992 by Electronic Gaming Monthly. They also awarded it Worst Movie-to-Game of 1996.

Source: Wikipedia, "Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84537.name: NES Satellite
84537.description:
Expands the NES to utilize up to four controllers. Connects controllers to the NES wirelessly by infrared (must have line of sight to the receiver). Also has Turbo for A and B.

Source: Wikipedia, "NES Satellite," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84538.name: Bureau 13
84538.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to Bureau 13: Stalking the Night Fantastic. I remember playing this game way back in 1983. I loved the setting, after all, who doesn’t love hunting down evil supernatural entities and destroying them! I hated the rules. Now, with the release of Savage Worlds, we have the perfect RPG system in which to explore the awesome Bureau 13 background. As they stand, the Savage Worlds rules fit the setting almost perfectly- any "tweaks" are mentioned in the text and the Rules of the Game section that follow. This supplement provides enough information with which to start a Bureau 13 campaign- expanding and adapting it beyond this is left to the creativity of the individual GM.

84539.name: Dark Days, Darker Nights
84539.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Savage survival in a modern gothic nightscape
This world is a contemporary version of the "Rippers" setting and borrows themes from the "World of Darkness" role-playing games as well as popular culture icons such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Blade and the stories of writers such as H.P. Lovecraft and Jim Butcher.

Features:

22 Character Concepts
11 new Edges
Over 80 new Spells and Powers spanning 5 different Arcane Backgrounds
Easy to use generators to create Celestial and Infernal "Outsiders"

84540.name: Rygar: The Legendary Adventure
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
84540.description:
Rygar: The Legendary Adventure takes place on an island in the Mediterranean Sea called Argus. Rygar is about to receive a wreath from Princess Harmonia in a ceremony for a victorious naval battle, when Titans suddenly attack led by Echidna. After she and Icarus capture Harmonia, Echidna has the Minotaur dispose of Rygar with a pit torn open in the ground. Surviving the encounter, Rygar finds the Diskarmor, a legendary shield of the gods and is given task to stop the Titans in order to rescue Harmonia and bring peace to Argus.

In Rygar: The Legendary Adventure, the player traverses the landscape armed with the Diskarmor, defeating enemies, collecting power-ups, and so forth. The camera is fixed in one location, but rotates when the player moves around accordingly. The game has many unlockable features, like picture and movie galleries.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rygar: The Legendary Adventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84541.name: Cthulhu Vice
84541.description:
Publisher Blurb:
It's Crockett and Tubbs meets Shub-Niggurath and Gugs!
This is an alternate reality version of the popular 1980’s television show "Miami Vice". While drug lords and narcotics trafficking are still major problems in this setting, so too are the occult influences of the Great Old Ones. The players are all part of an elite task force in the Metro-Dade Police Department. This team, called OCB (Occult Crimes Branch), is chartered with investigating all supernatural disturbances in the greater Miami area.

Features:

14 Character Concepts
18 new and modified Character Edges
"Wealth" system based on die types instead of cash
"Poker" style points-free Magic system
23 Monsters
33 Spells

84543.name: Fatemaster
84543.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Traditional Fantasy Role-Play

This High Fantasy setting is based on classical fantasy role-playing campaign worlds such as Middle Earth, Greyhawk and Forgotten Realms. It's a Savage Worlds and D&D hybrid that strives to let players get their Munchkin on a little bit. Fast and furious leveling, high powered characters and an open world where the players can pretty much do what they want. Welcome to Fatemaster.

Features:

A "class system" with 20 distinct classes that blends D&D style archetypes with Savage Worlds game mechanics.
A character generator that allows you to come up with quick NPCs on the fly.
"Retirement" rules that allow you to twink out new characters by putting old ones out to pasture.
Over 50 new or modified spells
An optional "Tarot Card" based character creation system.
A gazetteer for the world of Skaern including random encounter generators

84544.name: For King and Country
84544.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Steampunk "James Bond" style Superspy action set during the Napoleonic Wars
What if the Napoleonic Wars had been fought with advanced technology as well as muskets and cannon? In the race to have the most dominant technology, what battles might have been fought in the shadows of some of history's greatest and most terrible moments? "For King and Country" explores these and other questions as the players choose their allegiance and help their faction win glory and fame. Whose flag will be left standing when the last shot is fired?
This setting features:

13 new Character Concepts
Mechanautics: the Steampunk version of Cyberware
An engineering based magic system with over 20 new powers
Detailed reputation and social status rules
14 setting appropriate adversaries to throw at your players

84545.name: Sonic Advance 2
videogamehonor: 2003 Spike Best Handheld/Mobile Game of the Year Nominee
84545.description:
Sonic was going to Leaf Forest, until he saw Eggman kidnapping a female Rabbit and her Chao. Sonic rescues the Rabbit, whose name is Cream the Rabbit and her chao, called Cheese. Sonic then set off to find Eggman once again.

In comparison to its predecessor, Sonic Advance 2 is significantly faster-paced, and boasts larger level designs, an increased challenge and superior control over the playable characters. Rails are also easier to jump on compared to the first game. There are seven zones, each containing two acts and a boss battle, and there is a final zone at the end of the game that consists purely of boss fights. Obtaining all of the Chaos Emeralds unlocks the Extra Zone.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Advance 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84546.name: Nighthawks
84546.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A low-powered Superheroes setting that strives to emulate the gritty, street-level heroics of comics like Batman, Punisher, Daredevil, Hawkeye, The Shadow and Watchmen (sans Dr. Manhattan).
Crime has gotten out of control all over the world and costumed vigilantes have emerged as an augmentation of beleaguered law enforcement agencies everywhere. The popular media has taken to calling these vigilantes "Nighthawks" because they typically prey on crooks under the cover of darkness.
This setting features:

"Super Edges" -- a new category of Edges that help to quickly and easily define a Super Powerset for a low-powered campaign
Rules for building Super Weapons, Armor, Vehicles and Lairs
King City: a new setting based on a contemporary metropolis where Nighthawks can duke it out with crooks and villains
52 "Instant NPCs" that can be randomly sprinkled into your gaming sessions

84547.name: Heavy Shreddin'
84547.description:
Heavy Shreddin is a video game about snowboarding that was released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1990.

Gameplay

There are three mountains that the player must overcome in order to complete the game. As the player descends the mountain the terrain becomes more and more difficult to navigate. There are three degrees of difficulty on each of the mountains. The first is novice (marked by a circle), the second is intermediate (marked by a square), and the third is expert (marked by a diamond).

Source: Wikipedia, "Heavy Shreddin'", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84548.name: Savage Slaygoria
84548.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The world of Urth is a seething, sweaty and blood-smeared cesspit of violence, casual sex, buggery and gratuitous sword poses. Here the ruins are ALL cyclopean, the armor is ALL skimpy and damn near everyone is evil to the bone. All magic is linked to demon worship; it is a world with twenty-four separate hells and no heaven in sight. Weather is extreme; dragons and dinosaurs roam steaming jungles; wild demons and witches scheme in wintry caves. Three moons hang over fetid cities full of corrupt rulers and bold thieves. This is Urth, where only the magnificently well-oiled and amoral survive. Do you have what it takes to conquer this fractious world and put its nations under your boot? Will you one day proclaim yourself Overlord? That question can only be answered by deeds, blood and steel.
Features:

17 Character Concepts
34 New Edges (including 26 "Origin" Edges)
3 Magic Systems: Cabalism, Wizardry and Demonspawn
Over 76 Spells and Powers
29 Monsters
A fleshed out World Guide covering 26 different Nations (includes both a Player friendly version and Gamemaster version)

84549.description: Luca and his white dog Baldur are to look after the tinted colour-sheep. The little shepherd leads the green sheep to a very green meadow, but what does that yellow sheep need? A book for reading out loud, to look at, to tell stories, a story on colours and tinted sheep, and a game in which to roll the die and thread the sheep onto a woollen string. Luca moves from spot to spot, if all the sheep and the dog are threaded before the sun sinks, all animals can sleep in the barn and the game is won.
84549.name: Luca und die Farbenschafe

84550.name: Sector Zero
84550.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A Savage Worlds campaign setting inspired by Sci-Fi pop-culture.
Features:

5 playable races
18 Character Concepts
Extensive Gaming Aids: Character Stands, Ship Templates, Star Chart and Random Alien Generator
A Random Mission Generator
Ship-to-Ship combat system that relies upon teamwork between crew members
24 Star Systems to explore or add to your own campaigns

84551.name: The Guns of Megiddo
84551.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The fictional Wild West town of Megiddo, located in Cochise County, Arizona is the setting for this particular campaign. The time is between the American Civil War and the Turn of the Century, around 1870. The town of Megiddo is a fictionalized representation of popular Wild West destination towns like Deadwood, Tombstone and Dodge City. Consider Megiddo to be all of these places rolled up into one.
Features:

13 Character Concepts
53 pre-generated personalities that you can use to populate your Western adventures
A "Reputation" system that provides a twist on how gunslinger duels are settled
Details the fictional town of "Megiddo" which you can use in your own campaign settings.

84552.name: Kung Fu Chaos
84552.description:
User Summary

The game ports the player into the world of Kung Fu B-movies. Each stage is made up of training missions, mini games and fights which must all be passed to a certain level in order to complete the film and move onto the next stage (film).

Multi player action sees the contestants trying to be the best at the various mini games through either skill or underhand tactics.

84553.name: Mad Scramble
84553.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shouldn’t your reaction speed matter for more then the first round? Do you want Realistic, Standard d20, Cinematic, Martial Arts, or Anime-style combat? The Initiative System you use sets the tone for the entire battle.

To help you customize combat and give your games the exact tone you want, Distant Horizons Games presents Mad Scramble - a dozen Initiative systems, 52 options for customizing them further, and a few new feats, poisons, and bits of magic to round things off. Enough new options to spice up even the most jaded d20 campaign.

We have fast and simple systems, detailed systems, systems for Cinematic, Anime, and Martial Arts combat, and several systems which aren't dependent on any one game system. Not only do they all work fine in d20, but you can pull and apply them to any game you play!

When everyone is in a Mad Scramble you don't want to be caught dead last, do you?

Mad Scramble. Because sometimes, you absolutely, positively, have to go first.

84554.name: Firefly
84554.description: User Summary: A web-published conversion of the Firefly television series to the Savage Worlds system. Covers background, character options, equipment, setting and slang.

84555.name: Random Deities: A Madness Divine
84555.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just the facts Ma’am. Can you give us any more details on the thief?

He was eight feet tall, had a spear made of flame and a face covered with living tattoos, and was carrying the ruby chalice you use to pour out the colors of the sunset?

Sounds like Eranith, the Rendathian god of Twilight. Probably trying to expand his range of influence a bit.

Get him in the lineup and let’s see if she can pick him out.

Most established settings have the major deities laid out. The minor ones rarely get a mention. Everybody knows about Neptune - but how many remember Oceanus and Tethys, Pontus, Nereus, Phorcys, Ceto, Panope, Galatea, Thetis, Amphitrite, Triton, Proteus, Iapetus, Scylla, Glaucus, Leucothea, and Melicertes? What about the Nereids (Goddesses of the waves), Naiads (Goddesses of brooks and fountians), and Oceanids (Goddesses of bays and regions)?

For every mighty god, there are a hundred tiny ones. Nobody has time to detail them all, but it’s always fun to have a few local cults, shrines, or secret societies devoted to a god none of the players has ever heard of.

So here’s a quick way to make them. Just make a few rolls on the:

Random Deity Name Table - Be completely random, or pick a cultural subtable.
You must not forget! The name is Klatu - Barada - Nicto!
Random Portfolios and Domains Table - The god of WHAT?
Small God Portfolios Table - For when a full-sized god just won’t do.
Divine Functionaries Table - For deities who have a job to do.
Random Domains Table - For rounding out your deities’ aspect.
Favored Weapons Table - How will your deity - or its priests - strike back?
Relationship With Priests/Divine Personalities Table - What’s this god like, and how do its priests see it?
Deity Sex Table - To add a pronoun other than “it” to what you’ve already rolled.
Divine Attributes Table - What will you swear by? Charel’s Flaming Talons, Elgar’s Radiant Mercy, or Kadim’s Iron Serpents?
Favored Followers Table - Who does this god particularly approve of?




Random Deities. Because sometimes, you just need to pull a miracle out of your hat.

84556.name: Savage Gamma World
84556.description:
User Summary: A web-published conversion of the Gamma World to the Savage Worlds system.

Web-Blurb:
Post-Apocalypse/Sci-Fi - this is a Savaged version of the first 3 Editions of the classic post-apocalyptic RPG put out by TSR back in dark ages of the early 80's.

84557.name: The Practical Enchanter
84557.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic - the dream of doing the impossible - lies at the heart of all fantasy.

Magical artifacts and powers have fueled millennia of tales. They have been told in temples and igloos, longhouses and theaters, in the deep caverns of the earth and beneath the wheeling stars. Across the ages have come the legends of their making, their discovery, and their use.

We’re mostly concerned with making them.

The Practical Enchanter is a complete guidebook to magical items and personal powers. Within its 240 pages you’ll find:

Template Spells - covering every magical function and millions of individual spells (we gave up on trying to calculate how many after the Enhance Attribute template went past a million variants all by itself).
Heartstones - the enchantments at the core of both major and minor mystical orders. Will you found your own magical group, join an established one, or go your own way?
Wards Major - the powers and creation of enchanted buildings, castles, and lands!
Creating, modifying, and buying off precise ECL Adjustments and Templates.
Full rules for Curses, Summoning, Channeling Spirits, and Feat-Granting spells and devices.
Runic Inscriptions and Ritual Magic.
A broad selection of Charms and Talismans - new magic item types guaranteed not to wreck your game!
Rules for Superheroes, Cybertechnology, Mecha and Powered Armor.
Living in a Magical World - your guide to noncombative magic and fantasy life.
42 new mystical Feats with dozens of advanced options.
Talents and Wealth Level Templates - an option for taking the magic out of your collection of items and putting it back into your character!
Black Magic Charms and Talismans - for when you need a plot device right now.
Expanded Enchantment and Research Tables, allowing for the inclusion of mystic quests, exotic ingredients, and many new options and functions for your spells and magical items!
Complete rules for creating or customizing your own Constructs and Golems.
Advanced rules for Sacred and Profane bonuses and new Turning options.
How to create your own Extradimensional Realms.
New items, procedures, class variants, city rules, and character conversion rules. Where does all the money spent on making items go anyway?
Practical commentary and observations from our consultants - Lute, Grod, Commander Varsin, Guildmage Xanos, and Guard Commander Elidon.

84558.name: Idéspelet
84558.description: Idéspelet is both a board game and a creativity tool. In the game the players create ideas around a given question and pitch-battle these against each other. The greatest ideas advance in rank and the weaker go back for another iteration and another chance. In the end the player with the highest ranking is proclaimed the winner.

84559.name: Neighbors From Hell
84559.description:
User Summary

Play as Woody, star of TV show 'Neighbours From Hell', in attempt to keep your neighbour angry and thus your ratings high. Over fourteen levels you must strategically lay traps and pranks to hurt and annoy your neighbour whilst always staying out of his reach. Learn his movement patterns and ways to sneak past the various pets in order to string the pain together and keep the anger gauge high.

84560.name: Savage Heavy Gear
84560.description:
From the introduction:

Heavy Gear is such a great universe. The intent is not so much to perfectly translate every aspect of the game as to make it playable and usable with Savage Worlds rules, while keeping with the spirit and ambiance so dear to Terra Nova. Also, an effort has been made to keep the published material usable with the least effort possible, keeping your library (and purchases!) useful. The bare minimum needed to play would be the Heavy Gear 3rd Edition Player's Handbook (DP9-925), but a copy of the Silhouette Core Rules could come in handy in case of « shakey » conversion situations.

84563.name: NCAA Basketball
84563.description:
NCAA Basketball (known as World League Basketball in Europe and Super Dunk Shot in Japan) is a basketball video game which was developed by Sculptured Software and/or HAL Laboratory for the Super NES.

Source: Wikipedia, "NCAA Basketball (SNES)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84564.name: Waialae Country Club: True Golf Classics
84564.description:
Waialae Country Club: True Golf Classics is the second golf game by T&E Soft for the Nintendo 64, and first for that system outside of Japan. It is set in the Waialae Country Club, Honolulu, Hawaii. The game was released in 1998, there is also a game released for the Super Nintendo named, True Golf Classics: Waialae Country Club, the two are not the same however. It was preceded by the game Masters '98: Haruka Naru Augusta which was released in Japan in 1997, and had very similar style graphics and game play although both are different courses and in different locations.

Source: Wikipedia, "Waialae Country Club: True Golf Classics", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84565.name: Cooper's Corrected Creature Codex
84565.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are your d20 monsters....correct? Meet ENWorld staff reviewer John Cooper, known as "the nit-picky stat block guy". He's been invited by Dog Soul to comb through the core monsters and correct anything that seems amiss. Fully bookmarked and easy to print, each pdf also includes "Cooper's Comments" sidebars, which explain what John changed and why he made the changes that he did. "Cooper's Comments" also prompt the DM to check for possible synergy bonuses in instances where a given creature has a skill or skills that still need to be plugged in, like “Craft (any)” or “Knowledge (any three).” Cooper's Corrected Creature Codex - the definitive monster resource for both GM's and d20 publishers.

84566.name: NFL Quarterback Club '98
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
1998 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
84566.description:
NFL Quarterback Club '98 is a football video game, released in November 1997. It was developed by Iguana Entertainment and published by Acclaim for the Nintendo 64.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL Quarterback Club '98", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84568.name: 16½ Magic Codpieces
84568.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dog Soul's first annual April Fool's release.

Well, you've seen those other books by that other publisher, you know the ones; 17 Magic This and 17 Magic That... well this one was bound to happen, and we thought that it should be from somebody other than the guy with the really funny name.

So here you have it! /16 1/2 Magic Codpieces!/ (It would have been 17, but there was a little bit of, well, shrinkage.)
In this book you will find a collection of tallywhacker protective devices all designed to enhance any male proudly sporting them. From the Codstrap of Thesticles to the Codpiece of the Beast to Grimblethingy Thadpunk’s Interfacing Parsing Distributor (the fastest gnomish crotch cannon in existence), there's something for everyone in this one impressive package!

NOTE: In case you didn't figure it out, this one is recommended for a mature audience...well, at least for those who have reached adulthood according to a calendar. You can't be that mature!

84569.name: NFL Quarterback Club '99
videogamehonor: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Gameplay Engineering of the Year Nominee
1999 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
84569.description:
NFL Quarterback Club '99 released in November 1998, for Nintendo 64, is one of the first sports games to work with the Expansion Pak. The game featured all the NFL teams, replay past Super Bowls and history on the past Super Bowls. NFL Quarterback Club '99 delivers all 31 teams and 3D rendered stadiums. More than 1,500 players are here with over 250 motion-capture animations. Players, along with teams, uniforms, coaches, and playbooks, can also be created. Play-by-play is handled by Randy Cross and Mike Patrick while the artificial intelligence was developed by Charlie Weis, former NFL coach and former head coach of Notre Dame's Fighting Irish.

Other than that, the graphics are high resolution, with the optional expansion pak and rumble pak. The expansion pak only makes replays longer and slightly improves overall performance.

Source: Wikipedia, "NFL Quarterback Club '99", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84570.name: Taxibo
84570.description:
From the rules:
Taxibo is a unique Surinamese board game, which takes you by taxi through the centre of Paramaribo. It is a game for 2 to 4 players and consists of 1 dice, 16 pieces in 4 colours and a board.

From the website:
First Surinamese boardgame, developed by Gerrit Baron for the whole family. Taxibo is a taxi game which takes place in Paramaribo. Each of the four players owns a taxi company, who's four cars stand in four different garages. very exciting and above all educational.

Discription: Taxibo is a basic role and move game with some similarities to Sorry. Players move their pawns (taxi's) by rolling dice. The board represents (in an very abstract manner) the streets of Paramaribo. The end goal is getting all four taxi's to the central square. The players who first achieves this wins. Some of the spaces of the board are related to famous sights in Paramaribo and require a player who lands on them to do things such as skip turns, roll again, etc.

84571.name: Races of Consequence
84571.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the beginning, the interbreeding of the standard fantasy races has gone unmentioned or denied. The six races have stood unmixed: dwarves, elves, gnomes, halfl ings, humans, and orcs. Halfelves and half-orcs are the exception to this rule. The spectrum of other half-breeds, born of the crossbreeding between two (or even three!) other races, has been taboo, confined to creative GMs and their players. Until now…

Welcome to Races of Consequence, a d20 sourcebook that brings seventeen new player races to the gaming table. This unique sourcebook combines the seven standard Player’s Handbook races and presents a unique crossbreed for each racial combination. The core philosophies of this book are gaming balance and creative freedom.

Each new race is an ECL +0 race, following in the footsteps of the races presented in the Player’s Handbook. Races of Consequence also includes nineteen new racial feats, six new racial prestige classes, six new deities and rules for the races found in this sourcebook.

84572.name: Остров Страха
84572.description:
From publisher:

The Island of Fear
Can you survive until sunrise?

A plane carrying a group of tourists to the Maldives crashes in the Indian Ocean. On the first night after the crash, the survivors realize that there were werewolves on the plane with them. These fiends organized the whole crash so that they could hunt down some humans in the moonlight. There is only one way to survive until the rescue crew arrives – find out who the werewolves are and lynch them.

The Island of Fear is probably the most advanced version of the world-renowned Mafia game. First of all, in addition to the normal tourists and werewolves, there is a sexual predator, a clairvoyant, a nurse, a witch, an untouchable, a nightwalker, a half-blood werewolf and even a were-hamster. All sorts of nasty surprises can be expected from this colorful group of people. Second, the game contains a set of event cards that create specific events as the game progresses. Third, there are object cards that can both help or hinder the owner. Finally, the game comes with a DVD with mood-setting backgrounds and a timer for day-time voting. Also included are a chart and voting tokens to help manage the game.

84573.name: Def Jam Vendetta
videogamehonor: 2003 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2004 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
84573.description:
Def Jam Vendetta is a 2003 professional wrestling video game that combined hip hop with pro wrestling. The game plays very similarly to WWF No Mercy, and features a lengthy story mode that allows you to level up and enhance one of four player characters in your quest to become the most well known star in the urban fighting league and fight the undefeated underground boss, D-Mob.

Source: Wikipedia, "Def Jam Vendetta", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84574.name: Villains - The Brotherhood of Mahlik
84574.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mahlik was a typical orphan at the Brotherhood of Penitent Grace, a monastic order who made their home in a monastery embedded in the foothills of the northern mountains. He was found crying for food in an alley in the nearby town, brought in from the rain, cleaned up, and given a name. The Brothers named him Mahlik, which they told him meant "Fortunate One." They said they chose this name because he was found so young, before much in the way of tragedy could find him while he was alone and defenseless. He learned quickly the lessons they taught him; reading, figuring, critical thinking, and how to hold his tears when he was being whipped. They didn't try hard to teach him the latter - experience did that, as tears seemed to drive the whipkeepers into greater efforts.

The monks did not realize that another, more evil presence had taken notice of Mahlik. Soon they would learn to regret their sadistic teachings, and suffer cruelly beneath the yoke of a new master.

The Brotherhood of Mahlik offers an in-depth look at the villainous npc 'Brother', as well as the evil presence that possesses him. In addtion detailed information is provided for the comrades and confidantes of Brother, as well as styles of speech and a sample map of the monastery.

84576.name: Kuro
84576.description:
from the developers website

(Kuro is a french Role playing game)

English:

Kuro is the basic book and the first part of a complete set. You'll find a description of Shin-Edo and that of the Japanese company in 2046, the necessary rules, archetypes ready-to-play scenarios as well as two introductory campaign leading to Kuro Tensei.

French:

Kuro est le livre de base et la première partie d’un jeu complet. Vous y trouverez la description de Shin-Edo ainsi que celle de la société japonaise en 2046, les règles nécessaires, des archétypes prêts-à-jouer ainsi que deux scénarios d’introduction à la campagne menant à Kuro Tensei.

84577.name: Rule Supplement 1: Mounted Combat
84577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rule Supplement 1: Mounted Combat is the most complete and authoritative resource for mounts and mounted combat in the D20 System. It includes rules for:

Flying mounts
Burrowing mounts
Climbing mounts
Swimming mounts
Large and small mounts
Intelligent mounts
Multiple riders
Riding platforms
Cavalry maneuvers
Warpacks
Contest Jousting
And more!




Inside you’ll also find new equipment, dozens of new skill uses, expanded descriptions of the Handle Animal and Ride skills, and more than 50 feats, along with all the rules you’ll ever need for riding a mount -- no need to flip back and forth between the core rulebooks!

84578.name: Frogger
videogameversion: Atari 8-Bit Sierra (Black Ink, Gold Foil) edition
84578.description:
Frogger is an arcade game introduced in 1981. It was developed by Konami, and licensed for worldwide distribution by Sega/Gremlin. The object of the game is to direct frogs to their homes one by one. To do this, each frog must avoid cars while crossing a busy road and navigate a river full of hazards. Skillful players may obtain some bonuses along the way. The game is regarded as a classic from the golden age of video arcade games and was noted for its novel gameplay and theme. Frogger is still popular and versions can be found on many Internet game sites.

Source: Wikipedia, "Frogger", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84579.name: The Incredible Crash Dummies
84579.description:
User Summary

The Incredible Crash Dummies is a platform video game based on the characters from the 80s seat belt PSAs. The player must navigate a series of levels in an attempt to reach and defeat the `Junkman.'

It was released for the Nintendo Entertainment System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, and SEGA Genesis. Though the 16-bit version differed dramatically from the 8-bit, having an alternate plot and gameplay. There were also a number of hand held releases made, but those were a different game altogether.

The hand held versions followed the game play of the SEGA Master System title of the same name. The Dummies of that version worked in assorted hazardous product testing to earn money to go on vacation.

84581.name: Ninja Gaiden Shadow
videogameversion: Denmark, Norway, Sweden & UK Game Boy Edition
84581.description:
User Summary

Ninja Gaiden Shadow is a side scroller game and a prequel to Ninja Gaiden. It is 1985, 3 years before the events of Ninja Gaiden.

You control Ryu Hayabusa and your quest is to defeat an evil Emperor who is threatening New York City. Your enemies include other humans, cyborgs and machines which you must defeat by means of your sword, or by using your magical "fire wheel" technique of which you have limited charges. You can recharge your magical power and your life by finding power ups along the five stages of the game. It goes without telling that a powerful boss awaits you at the end of each stage.

84582.name: Scales & Furs
84582.description:
From Introduction:

Within these pages you will find dozens of new magic items that will surely help you in adding creativity to your characters, campaigns, and overall gaming experience. The almost 70 items were inspired by the creatures of the Core Rulebook III and are presented in a precise, well-illustrated, and self-explanatory way, thus demonstrating that there is still room in your gaming table for these small yet essential details.

84583.name: Jeopardy! (N64)
84583.description:
From the back of the box:

Jeopardy!
We have the answers...
Do you have the questions?

Get set for all the fast-paced fun and excitement of Jeopardy! You can now this popular TV Game Show at home.

Be first to press your buzzer and the cash is yours. And if you're fast and smart enough, you may go on to win the championship!

There are almost 2,000 "Answers" to challenge you in over 400 categories... all waiting for your correct "Questions" for the big money. Game play is just like the real show - you even play Double Jeopardy and Final Jeopardy.

Get set to enjoy state-of-the-art graphics, the actual theme music, and hours of thrilling fun when you play JEOPARDY!

84584.name: Manhunt
videogamehonor: 2004 D.I.C.E. Adventure Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2006 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
84584.description:
Manhunt is a stealth game developed by Rockstar Games, it was released November 18, 2003 for the PlayStation 2 video game console, and April 20, 2004 for Xbox and Windows. Although it was generally well-received by critics, Manhunt created a controversy due to the graphic violence the player is encouraged to engage in. This resulted in the game being banned in several countries and implicated by media in a murder, although this implication was later rejected by the police.

Manhunt is a third-person stealth horror game. The game consists of twenty levels, and four bonus levels that can be unlocked; the levels are referred to as "Scenes". Players survive the Scenes by dispatching enemy gang members known as "Hunters", occasionally with firearms but primarily by stealthily executing them in gruesome over-the-top ways.

The player is rated from one to five stars at the end of each level which is largely affected by the gruesomeness of the killings and the speed of completion. Executions are preferred in order to gain a higher score, thus encouraging players to play as viscerally as possible. The game's locales are full of "dark spots" and shadows where the player can hide while being chased by the Hunters; hiding in these dark areas makes the player invisible to opponents.
Over the course of the game, the player uses a wide variety of weapons, ranging from plastic bags, baseball bats, crowbars and all sorts of bladed items to firearms later on in the game. If the player is running out of health, painkillers can be found which replenish health. The player can strike walls or throw items such as bottles, tin cans, bricks and severed human heads to make noise to distract Hunters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Manhunt (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84586.name: Humanydyne
84586.description:
from the publisher's website

(Humanydyne is a french role playing game.)

English:

Humanydyne is a complete game set that will allow you to plunge into an alternate world, unveiling its facets with the seasons. In this world, very close to ours, superheroes do exist, leaping from building to building and fight villains with evil plans. But the reality is much darker than the comics.

Indeed, behind the dazzling facade of superheroes, hidden stories far more sordid murder, blackmail, terror, disappearances, racism ...

The characters are part of Humanydyne, an agency specializing in the investigation of post-humans. Each was once or could have become a superhero, one of the many costumed creatures and famous through the streets and skies of New York, Metropolis or Arkham City. Instead, they chose to hang up their capes and costumes, to return to anonymity in order to make their donations to the Agency Humanydyne.

French:

Humanydyne est un jeu de rôles complet qui va vous permettre de plonger dans un monde alternatif, dévoilant ses facettes au fil des saisons. Dans cet univers, très proche du nôtre, les super-héros existent bel et bien, sautant d’immeuble en immeuble et affrontant des super-vilains aux plans machiavéliques. Mais la réalité est bien plus noire que celle des comics.
En effet, derrière la façade éclatante des super-héros, se cachent des histoires bien plus sordides : meurtres, chantages, terrorisme, disparitions, racisme...

Les personnages font partie d’Humanydyne, une agence spécialisée dans les enquêtes sur les post-humains. Chacun d’eux fut autrefois ou aurait pu devenir un super-héros, un de ces nombreux êtres costumés et célèbres parcourant les rues et le ciel de New York, Metropolis ou Arkham City.
Au lieu de ça, ils ont choisi de raccrocher leur cape et leur costume, de rentrer dans l’anonymat afin de mettre leurs dons au profit de l’Agence Humanydyne.

84588.name: Syphon Filter
videogamehonor: 2000 D.I.C.E. Action Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2000 D.I.C.E. Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
84588.description:
Syphon Filter is a stealth third-person shooter video game for the PlayStation released in 1999. It is the first game in the Syphon Filter series. It was re-released on December 4, 2006, on the PlayStation Network for use on the PSP.

Source: Wikipedia, "Syphon Filter", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84589.name: Syphon Filter 2
84589.description:
Syphon Filter 2 is a stealth third-person shooter video game for the PlayStation. Released in 2000, its plot picks up immediately after where the previous Syphon Filter ended. It is the second title in the Syphon Filter series. Syphon Filter 2 was released on the PlayStation Store on September 10, 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "Syphon Filter 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84590.name: Les Nouveaux Russes
84590.description:
from the publishers website

English:

Les Nouveauw Russes offers all the elements necessary to find out what cold setting, away from the heat and libertarian Madreselva: intrigues in Moscow, the rebel city of St. Petersburg, the Moksha community monsters, but also multiple tracks scenarios and side stories. Comprehensive rules on the Dreamtime complete this work, and three scenarios plunging Agents in the heart of Russia.

French:

Les Nouveaux Russes vous propose tous les éléments nécessaires pour découvrir ce décor glacial, loin de la chaleur torride et libertaire de Madreselva : les intrigues moscovites, la cité rebelle de Saint-Pétersbourg, la communauté des monstres de Moksha, mais aussi de multiples pistes de scénarios et d’histoires secondaires. Des règles complètes sur le Temps du Rêve achèvent cet ouvrage, ainsi que trois scénarios plongeant les Agents au coeur de la Russie.

84591.name: Syphon Filter 3
84591.description:
Syphon Filter 3 is a stealth third-person shooter video game for the PlayStation. It was released in 2001, and is a sequel to Syphon Filter 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "Syphon Filter 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84592.name: Storypath Cards
rpgissuearticle: The Oft Bitter Pills: Capsule Reviews
84592.description:
"Feel like your [sic] GMing a bunch of couch roleplayers. Players who just sit there without getting involved. Players who react don't interact.

Then add
STORYPATH CARDS

Storypath cards are a play-aid designed for use with any roleplaying system no matter waht genre.

STORYPATH CARDS

Using the cards players can alter people, places and things thus intertwining them into the plot."

From the back of package.

84593.name: The Monstrous Soul
84593.description:
from the introduction of the book

The Monstrous Soul is a scenario for the french rpg Humanydyne.

It is episode 3 in the series and the story continues just after the end of the base book. It takes place in San - Sepulcro.

84594.name: Skate
videogamehonor: 2007 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2007 Spike Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Nominee
2008 D.I.C.E. Cellular/Mobile Game of the Year Winner
2008 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Winner
84594.description:
Skate (marketed as skate.) is a skateboarding video game developed by EA Black Box for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. It was released in North America on September 17, 2007 for the Xbox 360 and September 24, 2007 for the PlayStation 3 and in Europe on September 28, 2007 for the Xbox 360 and October 5, 2007 for the PlayStation 3. As of February 1, 2008, Skate has outsold the 2007 skateboarding game Tony Hawk's Proving Ground by a ratio of almost 2 to 1 on seventh generation video game consoles.

The player controls a custom-designed skateboarder in the fictional town of San Vanelona. Skating challenges are marked on a mini-map, along with stores and subway stations that allow the player to traverse the city quickly. As the player develops their skills and performs various tasks (such as completing certain tricks while being filmed), sponsorship and notability are acquired, eventually leading to participation in the X Games. "Filming" challenges allow the player to create a line of tricks to meet the filming goals; the player may also place a session marker to return to a spot quickly after finishing a line. Several "own the spot" locations throughout the city allow the player to try to claim that spot by beating a certain score requirement, thus "owning" the spot from other skaters. Additionally, there are jam sessions and "death races" against other AI-controlled characters. Completing challenges will generally unlock new clothing and equipment items, characters, and additional challenges to compete in. Players are able to create and edit short video clips (15 to 30 seconds) at any time, selecting desired camera angles and video effects, and upload them to EA's "Skate Reel" website to share with others.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skate (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84595.name: Skate 2
videogamefranchise: Platinum Hits (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, US)
videogamehonor: 2010 CVA Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2010 CVA Best Technology of the Year Nominee
2010 D.I.C.E. Best Sound Design of the Year Nominee
84595.description:
Skate 2 is a sandbox skateboarding video game developed by EA Black Box and distributed by Electronic Arts as a sequel to the 2007 game, Skate. Skate 2 was released in January 2009 on PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360.

Skate 2 is set five years after the events in Skate. During Skate It, many mysterious disasters (identified as earthquakes in Skate 2) devastated the city, leaving it in ruins and a mass evacuation of the city. The city has been changed to a noticeable standard, but if gamers have played the previous games, they may recognize familiar spots. The new city has been named New San Vanelona, or New San Van for short. However, instead of a skaters paradise the city used to be, security has been stepped up by Mongo Corp in order to protect the best parts of the city. Most of the good skating spots have caps on them to prevent skaters from skating on them, and security guards almost everywhere else. The player progresses through the story by completing challenges for magazines like The Skateboard Mag and Thrasher all before shooting a cover photo as a final mission for each magazine. The player also participates in Vert and Street Contests, as well as races. Throughout the game the player can choose board, truck, wheel, and shoe sponsorships from well-known skateboarding brands.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skate 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84596.name: Pain
84596.description:
Pain is a 2007 video game for the PlayStation 3, developed by games studio Idol Minds. It was originally released as a downloadable title available from the PlayStation Store and was first released in North America on November 29, 2007 and in Europe on March 20, 2008 and became the most popular downloadable game on the PlayStation Store.

Pain is a video game in which players attempt to damage the ragdoll character they play and the environment as much as possible by flinging them from a rubber-band catapult, using the Havok physics engine. Replay videos can be watched, and can be edited and uploaded to YouTube or the PlayStation 3's hard disc drive.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pain (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84597.name: Wonderlondres
84597.description:
Wonderlondres is a sourcebook for the french role playing game Humanydyne.

English:

In this new context Supplement Humanydyne for you to discover the consequences of the breakup of the Moon and the fall of the debris on the city of London. This capital, once a place of confrontation to colorful masks, is mutant became the second state of the world ... And Now all of a gigantic penitentiary. In this prison by a single anarchic immense concrete walls and robotsnspecialized in the extermination of masks, Agents discover sects of criminals perpetual conflict. They also gather, looking good, the charm of the City and emanations cruel beings living outside the time. But most of all the characters discover that not only lunar dust that now covers the devastated streets of the one we nicknamed
"Wonderlondres, the Cityweird. In the hollow of his belly and hatched plots the pulse heart of the monster.
What Agents get to understand. Finally, what connects all the people they crossed from their first mission in of Humanydyne. Cobre Tlaloc, Hans Merkin Revolucion, the pentagram, Roodnine,
Humanydyne ... So many parts of the same puzzle.

French:

Dans ce nouveau supplément de contexte pour Humanydyne, vous découvrirez les conséquences de la dislocation de la Lune et de
la chute de ses débris sur la ville de Londres.

Cette capitale, autrefois lieu d’affrontement pour des masques hauts en couleur, est devenue le second État mutant du monde... Et a maintenant tout d’un gigantesque pénitencier.
Dans cette prison anarchique isolée par une immense enceinte de béton et par des robots spécialisés dans l’extermination des masques, les Agents découvriront des sectes de criminels
en conflit perpétuel. Ils y retrouveront aussi, en cherchant bien, le charme de la City et les effluves cruelles d’êtres vivant hors du temps. Mais, plus que tout, les personnages
découvriront que ce n’est pas uniquement de la poussière lunaire qui recouvre désormais les rues dévastées de celle qu’on surnomme «Wonderlondres», la Cityweird. Au creux de son ventre se trament les intrigues et pulse le
coeur du monstre. De quoi amener les Agents à comprendre
enfin ce qui relie toutes les personnes qu’ils ont croisé depuis leur première mission au sein d’Humanydyne. Cobre Tlaloc, Hans Merkin, Revoluciòn, le Pentagramme, Roodnine,
Humanydyne... Autant de pièces d’un même puzzle.

(from the introduction of the book)

84598.name: Buzz!: The Big Quiz
videogamehonor: 2007 British Academy Game Awards Best Casual/Social Game of the Year Winner
84598.description:
Buzz!: The Big Quiz is the second in the Buzz! series of PlayStation 2 games developed by Relentless Software.

Source: Wikipedia, "Buzz!: The Big Quiz", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84599.name: Grudge Warriors
84599.description:
User summary:

In Grudge Warriors you are member of a gang bound to fight other gangs in a tournament in order to earn the favor of the mysterious Crimelord.

You control an armored vehicle with distinctive weapons with which you will attempt to blow the enemy vehicles to kingdom come, take out their power generators and destroy their bases. There are 23 missions to complete, during which you equip yourself with various power ups, such as invisibility, double damage, invulnerability and more, that you find along the way.

Once you defeat all ten rival gangs, you will have the chance to fight the Crimelord himself.

84600.name: rpgKids v1.5
84600.description:
A very simple RPG consisting of opposed die rolls using a d12, while encouraging kids to think creatively, perform simple arithmetic, and have fun!

The new version contains a few tweaks that people had been making and applied them to the rules. There is also a new healer class and some added materials:

The fully bookmarked, 24 page PDF also includes funny and kid friendly hand drawn tokens for both heroes and monsters, character cards and a printable 1″ grid.

But that’s not all, because it also includes a full introductory adventure, designed to show all the rules of the game at work, within the context of a fun quest.

rpgKids is suitable for kids from 4 years old, up until they can grasp a more complex game like D&D or some other rpg.

84601.name: Time Warriors
84601.description:
From the back of the package:

Earth beckons a new order. The Warriors of time revisit the past to decide the future...

Choose your champion and take part in the most amazing combat game you've ever seen on your PC.

Ten characters prepare to enter the tournament: each representing a great and powerful civilization; each with their own style and their own strengths and weaknesses. Each is rendered with incredible detail in smooth, fast 3D graphics.

Find the best within each with countless differing fighting moves and acrobatics - including weapons, magic and hidden powers that can only be released by a secret combination of movements!

> A magical and brilliant world is depicted in glorius 3D, with unique light sourcing: shadows, reflections, transparent effects and more.
