> Multiple game options, including different battle modes, auto-defence set-ups, multiple camera angles, slow motion replays; plus the ability to configure the game precisely to get the very best out of your computer.

> Mesmerizing scenery and startling sound effects will astound you.

> Choose between VGA and SVGA graphics.

> Play against the computer, or do battle to the death with a friend (or enemy)!

> Network gaming option

84602.name: Assassin X
84602.description:
Nobody knows who or when, but one player is going to be the killer! Discretion and assassination attempt on one side, and vigileance stalking each other. Suspense guaranteed!

Assassin X is based on a user specific trading card (55 originals cards) through which you build your game and influence your opponents. It is a game of strategy and psychology in which deception and bluff you will need to win!

The goal of the game is the first player to have 5 pts. You gains points if
1) Successful murder = 2 points
2) Countering murder = 1 point
3) Discover an assassin = 1 point

Each player receives 5 cards that they keep secret.
The rest is the deck face down. A sense of play is defined for a turn. It will be inverted at each new turn.
Each round takes place in two stages:
- A phase of trading between 2 players.
- A phase of action for any player

If you receive the card or draw Assassin
you become a murderer. Unless you try to get rid of it, you should prepare your murder by collecting maximum points with maps of Crime Guns, Approaches,and Masters. However, be careful not to be detect because it may well be another player sends you the Police and there, it would be over.
Assassinate when you're ready!

84603.name: Jewel Quest 2-in-1 Treasure Pack
84603.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Jewel Quest (the deluxe version) and Jewel Quest II for the iPhone.

84604.name: Jewel Quest Mysteries: Curse of the Emerald Tear
84604.description:
Jewel Quest Mysteries seamlessly combines a jewel-studded, hidden object game with a Match 3, mystery-solving adventure. Travel with Rupert and Emma to mystifying Egyptian locales, and take along an eye for hidden objects and your jewel-matching prowess. En route, collect coins and gems which can be exchanged for hints and added abilities.

In the land of King Tut's ancient secrets, Rupert and Emma hunt for the Emerald Tear, an olden Jewel Board rumored to have unexplainable power. Rupert and Emma are not alone in their search, and after a chance encounter with rival archaeologist, Philip Westing, Rupert falls into a sudden coma. With Rupert's jewel notes as her only guide, Emma delves into the history and haunts of Alexander the Great for clues that could save her husband. Emma soon learns of the Emerald Tear's inextricable ties to the rise and fall of the boy-king Tutankhamun. Can Emma trust the dubious characters who offer help? Familiar friends and foes emerge as the plot unravels.

Source: The Game Website.

84605.name: Jewel Quest Mysteries 2: Trail of the Midnight Heart
84605.description:
After answering her uncle's call, Eva Witheby winds up far from home and amidst strangers in Jewel Quest Mysteries Trail of the Midnight Heart. It's hard to know who to trust when treacherous trails and veiled secrets abound. Alongside Eva, uncover relics in eye catching hidden object screens. Unearth tools that will help you reveal shards of the precious jewel boards and discover all new scrolling search screens that put you in the front seat of whizzing planes and a whirlwind adventure. Jewel Quest Mysteries 2 is a hidden object adventure like no other!

Source: The Game Website.

84606.name: Mysteryville
84606.description:
You’re an ace reporter on assignment in Mysteryville, a small town that’s full of surprises. As you question the strange local townspeople to collect information for your article it doesn’t take you long to discover that something isn’t quite right in this charming little town… and just how dangerous being a journalist can be. Your seemingly simple assignment unfolds into a full-blown mystery adventure as you try to learn the secret of the Black Lotus and its ancient prophecy. Discover new possibilities as you untangle the tricky plot’s mystery and solve all of the game’s puzzles.

Featuring hours of seek-and-find fun, bizarre characters, and incredible graphics, Mysteryville is a surprising adventure for your senses.

Source: The Game Website.

84607.name: NES Advantage
84607.description:
User Summary

NES-026: Arcade-style joystick controller, with oversized A and B buttones, adjustable turbo controls, and a slow-motion button.

84609.name: ROLLICK!  The Hysterical Game of Clues and Collaboration
84609.description:
Rollick! is a hit party game that’s a fast and furious team competition.

With ROLLICK!, the entire team collaborates together to act out clues for one or more players to guess. It’s a hysterical, fun, fast-paced, team competition game that’s an absolute riot at parties, family gatherings, work events, holiday celebrations, with friends, and even loved by teenagers!

With over 750 clues, including words for younger children, suggestions for large and small groups, and other fun variations, no game is ever the same!

For hours of hysterical fun – the choice is ROLLICK!

84610.name: Touch of Character
84610.description: User Summary: Collection of NPCs with stats and plot hooks presented at various levels of development. This volume includes Alydric the Expert and Ysigold the Aristocrat.

84611.name: NES Controller
84611.description:
NES-004: Standard NES controller; rectangular with a 4-direction joypad, Select, Start, A, and B.

The Japanese Famicon did not come with loose controllers; and they were not sold separately. The AV Famicon (HVC 101) however, did come with separate controllers, that probably also were sold separately.

84612.name: In the 1st Degree
84612.description:
User summary:

In this interactive legal adventure game you take the role of Sterling Granger, a San Fransisco District Attorney. You are in charge of the prosecution in a murder and grand theft trial, and your task is to try and prove that both accusations are correct.

Your object during pre-trial is to examine various pieces of evidence and to question witnesses and other people involved in the case. The witnesses' attitude towards you, and the way they treat you changes depending on the questions you ask and the way you ask them. The questions you ask appear in the form of an interactive pre-recorded video segment. Different questions elicit different responses from witnesses, and may or may not allow for follow-up questions. You do all this from a first person perspective.

Depending on the quality of your work as a prosecutor, and if you manage to elicit the proper responses from witnesses, you can go to trial having a very strong case against the accused. You can thus manage a conviction for first degree murder and grand theft auto for the accused, and victory for you.

If on the other hand your case is poorer, you have a range of possible weaker outcomes. The worst possible outcome is the dismissal of the case and your humiliation. There are also possibilities for the accused to be acquitted, and various lesser convictions such as manslaughter, grand theft auto, or second-degree murder.

84613.name: EA Sports F1 2001
84613.description:
From the box back:

BLISTERING SPEED, RELENTLESS RIVALRY

Features


Bold Intelligent Opponents


Race against agressive drivers who want to win as badly as you do.

The First PC Game To Include The Official 2001 Formula One World Championships




All 17 tracks, 11 teams, and 22 drivers including Michael & Ralf Schumacher, Jacques Villeneuve, and Juan Pablo Montoya.

190-MPH Traffic Jams




Fight a packed field at every sweeping bend, high-speed straight and haripin turn.

The World Of Formula One




Experience buzzing pre-race grids through cutting edge graphics and sound

Driver Training




Boost your driving skills using the Arrows 2-seat Formula One training car.

Inside Formula One




Develop with professionals from the real world of Formula One

boardgamehonor: 2010 Charles S. Roberts Best Expansion or Supplement for an Existing Game Nominee
84614.description:
(from Compass Games website:)

Bring added realism to your submarine campaign with IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy, the first expansion pack for Compass Games’ award winning SILENT WAR.

Every Japanese warship down through the large destroyer escorts and the major auxiliary cargo ships and tankers are provided in two full countersheets with 336 new playing pieces for the game and rules to integrate them seamlessly into the game. IJN, Imperial Japanese Navy also brings new rules to SILENT WAR such as loners, crash dive, and targeting escorts, rules introduced in the follow on game, STEEL WOLVES.

A must have expansion pack for any dedicated SILENT WAR player. Requires SILENT WAR to play.
84614.name: IJN
boardgameexpansion: Silent War

84615.name: Mnemonic
84615.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Mnemonic is the second Alpha-Zulu rpg. It basically popped into my head one night when I was trying to work on a magic system for Alternacy. This was back in April, 1998, and I had the basics of the system written up within about a month. A couple of helpful members of the Alternacy Update Mailing List provided some feedback over the summer and the current edition was written and revised during September, October, and November.

While I suppose there are shades of Mnemonic that can be detected in Alternacy, it is a significantly different type of roleplaying game. It's basically my attempt to create the fastest, lightest rules I possibly could while still retaining a useful, not-too-grainy system. Very little rules awareness is required of players; while there's a system present, it strives for transparency. It’s an odd goal, but I also wanted to create a game that could be played while one was on a road trip. I don’t really take that many road trips anymore, but that’s still the benchmark that got stuck in my mind and wouldn’t leave. I believe I succeeded.

There are three fundamental points about Mnemonic that should help you decide if it’s the type of game for you:


It’s Simple. Mnemonic falls into the “minimalist” rpg camp. It’s built to provide basic ratings of character traits, a means for referees to determine the difficulty and outcome of attempted actions, and a very general system for tracking health and vitality. That’s about it. This means the rules don’t get in the way of play, but they also can’t provide much detail or ambience.



It’s Portable. Mnemonic is designed to be playable while traveling, sitting at lunch, or even stranded on the proverbial desert island. It can be played with little or no equipment while still retaining the random element of diced gaming. I'm hoping this will also make it highly suitable for online gaming.



It Can Be Memorized. The rules contain mnemonic devices that allow players and refs to memorize everything necessary for play. Once you learn them you’ll have a complete (though simple) roleplaying game in your head.


Like Alternacy, Mnemonic is a universal system. You can use it for play in any type of setting, and suggestions are included for handling everything from warships to dragons with the same rules.

84616.name: The Imperial Herald (Volume 3, Issue 5 - September 2010)
rpgissuearticle: A Closer Look at Empire at War
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
84616.description:
In this issue:

A Closer Look at Empire at War
Hero of the Pass
Seeds of Destruction
Kotei Recap
Not Competitive?
Enemies of the Empire

This issue of the Imperial Herald was printed in Newspaper format - far too large for a scanner! It comes folded and the images reflect this.

84617.name: Alternacy
84617.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Alternacy, The Roleplaying System is the first game I presented online. Originally located on a GeoCities website, it was introduced in late July/early August of 1997. Updated versions were produced the following October and February. The files available for download now are basically identical to the February version of 1999.

I’ve come to think of my work on Alternacy as an attempt to solve a number of problems I’d encountered in other games. My basic goal was a game containing a detailed method of quantifying character traits married to a flexible means of handling action resolution. I wanted a comprehensive skill list that was still flexible and reasonably brief, thus Techniques and Custom Skills were born. My desire for a detailed assessment of character attributes led to a whopping sixteen Talents. The system for determining the advance and decline of skills, both at character creation and during play, allows for a wide variety of skill levels tied directly to character activity and ability rather than a standard experience/character point approach. The dice mechanic provides centralized results more often than extreme highs and lows, and the ref’s tools for rating the difficulty of attempted actions is based on perceived challenge, allowing for varying power levels unique to each referee. In a sense, Alternacy is my attempt to refine and advance upon the accomplishments of traditional gaming.

In my view, Alternacy is a moderately complex game. Character creation and advancement both require a fair bit of time and effort, but actual play moves rather quickly. It’s a universal system, meaning it can be used to play in any genre or setting. As already mentioned, it strives to give players a detailed assessment of their character’s abilities, but leaves the details of game events to the discretion of referees. It includes some steps towards a rules-light approach, but I think I’d still classify it as a more or less conventional system.

I'm not sure if I'll be doing any more work on Alternacy or if it's current form represents the final version. I'd like to adjust the wound system as it seems more cumbersome than I'd like, and I've thought about going through and cleaning up the writing, hunting a few typos and making things more clear. I'd still like to make a magic system for it, and have toyed with multi-game magic tools that would be suitable. I haven't worked on it for ages, though, so it's probably complete, or at least very close. At any rate it is certainly playable as is.

84618.description:
Description from publisher:

Un juego "pipí cucú" para revivir lo más divertido de la época.

En este juego, los setentosos y ochentosos, tienen que contestar preguntas, actuar, dibujar, silbar y mucho más...recordando lo más
divertido de la época.

¿Te animás a actuar representando al "Super agente 86" y dibujar un balero...o al Correcaminos; y a silbar "Menta y Limón"... o "Cleopatra"?


Is a mix between Trivial Pursuit, Pictionary and acting, everything based on the music, tv, movies and culture of the 70s and 80s. Players must act, answer questions, draw, whistle, and sing in various competitions.

84619.name: Rise of Heroes
84619.description:
Publisher's Blurb

It is the year 2350 A.D... 274 years after Earth’s third world war, which became known as the Holocaust (Estimated Survivors 823,000,000). For many years now, civilization has reconstructed itself at vastly different rates across the entire planet's surface. A few areas grow rapidly, having discovered new substances and scientific elements. Technology thrives with many new concepts including cyber technology, hover propulsion, new medicines, weaponry, space research and even some new types of energy.

On the other hand 80% of the planet remains torn apart from the Holocaust. Having little technology (if any), no medical supplies, weak law enforcement and suffer from the spread of many new diseases.

The earth's surface consists of mostly desert, with a few large forested regions, jungles and lakes. The oceans still have huge bodies of water being reduced only 5%, but have been polluted beyond recoverable status. This is not to say that life cannot flourish within the oceans. Some species have adapted very well to the waters strange effects but most cannot survive for an extended period of time. Therefore the life cycles have dramatically increased. As for human involvement, many large underwater Aqua Stations have been built and a few underwater cities have been established.

Day to day, people in general live their lives as expected. Either starving on the streets or thriving off of another's downfall. Crime rates are through the roof while law enforcement is becoming more erratic with every day that passes. Lethal drugs and disease’s spread through communities faster than government corruption but most cities have local hospitals with the proper vaccines readily available, considering that if you still have a wallet or you can make it to the hospital in the first place.

Transportation consists of hover vehicles and many salvaged pre-holocaust vehicles, at least in the cities. While in the wastelands areas, walking is most common. A few wasteland exceptions drive modified pre-holocaust vehicles, dune-buggies, motorcycles etc....

Another great advancement is space research. With all the new technology coming about scientists have discovered new means of propulsion and agricultural growth. This has allowed for many explorations of the Moon, which eventually lead to the colonization of the Moon’s surface. Only a few hundred thousand live there but the Moon colony is quite vast, hosting some of mankind’s greatest inventions and minds. The moon is accessible to most seeking off world life but the price of getting there is outrageous for any newcomers. This limits the expansion of the colony to a few hundred a year. The colonies main existence is space research/exploration and military space construction.

84620.name: Mission Ascent
84620.description:
User summary:

A religious educational board game that introduces Catholics to the saints and their missions. Intended to help players understand God's calling in their own lives. Includes a book on the 76 featured saints.

Players move their pewter figurines around the board a la Monopoly. When landing on a color-coded square they answer one of four questions read from corresponding cards:

Blue - Light or humorous
Green - Scripture memory
Red - Thoughtful, reflective
Yellow - Lives of the saints

The first person to fully navigate the board by successfully answering questions wins.

The game takes about an hour to play and is geared to ages 10 and up. The goal is to learn more about one's faith, one's mission in life, and about the calling in other players' lives.

84622.name: Age of Frederick the Great
84622.description:
User Summary

Age of Frederick the Great - Wargame Rules for the Seven Years War is a miniatures rules set that includes a card-driven resolution system.

Rules cover sequence of play, movement, terrain effects, fire, melee, morale and rally, the leader action cards (and how to create them), game scale, and unit and army organization.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)

84623.description:
From the box front: Raid Elmer Fudd's vegetable patch and collect the most carrots

User summary: At the start of the game, players get a supply of carrots. On each turn, every player gets a card. When any two vegetable cards match, everyone grabs for a Bugs Bunny piece, with enough for every player but one (i.e. three Bugs pieces for four players). Whoever does not get a Bugs piece must give a carrot to the other players. In addition, there are three Elmer Fudd cards. If one of these turns up, no one should grab for Bugs. If they do touch Bugs, they must give up two carrots to each other player. The same penalty applies for touching Bugs when there are no matching cards.

When one player runs out of carrots, the game is over, and the player with the most carrots wins.
84623.name: What's Up, Doc? The Bugs Bunny Game

84624.description:
From the Introduction

"Last year I promised to present for discussion a set of rules covering the Armada period of naval warfare. Here are those rules, or rather a fast play version of the Channel Wargames Group's current set.

"The philosophy behind them is both to make an attempt to make a set of rules that give a good flavour of the period and the methods of fighting with ships current at that time. And to make the games played with them as enjoyable as is possible. Because of this things such as gunnery have been simplified as much as possible.

"Ships gunnery at the time of the Armada was a thing in a state of flux. It is as well to contemplate, that ships carried many different types of ordinance, all intermingled together on the same deck. The logistics of serving such a varied armament in a rapid manner was beyond the capabilities of the time, and I would hazard a guess beyond us today as well. Most authorities give a maximum rate of fire for the guns of the Spaniards as once, yes once, a day. Small pieces and hand held weapons were obviously much quicker to reload. Even the English rate of fire is said to have been at best once an hour. If this difference had been used in the rules the Spanish player's would be sitting on their for much of the game, and the English for quite long periods. The solution to this problem can be read in the rules themselves..."

User Summary

Rules set covers scale, speed of units, sailing rules, handling classes, wind effects, firing, ranges, firing charts, special effects table (effectively a sort of critical hit table), putting out fires, effects of bowing on hull factors, boarding, morale, special rules for galleys, a ship list, and a brief bibliography. Game requires models (1/600 preferred for ease of scratch building), and two types of dice (d6 & d20).

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)
84624.name: Fast Play Armada Rules

84625.name: Archeoegypt
84625.description: A gorgeous game in resin, coming in a huge wooden box. Two players or teams must dig for the Pharao's treasure, finding hints that will help them in the search. The valley of the Sphinx is made of little 3D spaces in resin that can be lifted to see what's under. A guide with the reproduction of real ancient Egyptian documents is featired to translate the hieroglyphics and identify Pharaos' names. The cost was impressive (150.000 liras - equivalent of 77.50 euros that was a really huge sum in mid '90s).

84626.description:
User Summary

Hour of the Gun - Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2 is a set of three linked miniatures scenarios and a rules set that covers the events surrounding the infamous gunfight at the OK Corral. Scenarios include: Street Fight at the Ok Corral, Tucson Stockyards Ambush, & Shootout at Iron Springs. Characters surviving a scenario (from either the Earp or Clanton faction) are eligible to appear in the next scenario. Off table events (like an assassination attempt on the Earps) between the scenarios help to build suspense.

Effectively this is a set of skirmish scenarios with characters that are drawn from history. Characters that didn't appear at the events in question, but that might have, are included in charts of "Improbables." Historical figures that did participate are found in the "Probable" charts, and have a much higher chance of participating. Percentile dice are used to determine the characters in the various scenarios.

Each character has their own set of characteristics which include: Reaction, Control, Bravery, Dexterity, Agility, Physical, Panic Distance, Security Distance, Pistol Skill, Rifle Skill, Hand Weapon Skill, & Fists Skill.

Game requires various old west miniatures and terrain, along with 2d10 for percentile rolls and single d10 rolls.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #178 (July 2002)
84626.name: Hour of the Gun: Tombstone, Arizona, 1881-2

84627.name: Not So Quiet
84627.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It’s no longer quiet on the Western Front. An ancient horror is stirring and something dark walks the halls of Hospital Number Five.

Bullet-ridden, bruised and bloody, the Investigators, soldiers and nurses in the Great War, are brought from the fontline to Military Hospital Number Five.

Haggard staff make their rounds, the doctors experiment after dark with electro-shock therapy, gaunt nurses give unlabelled and unknown drugs. Patients are dying by the dozen when they once seemed to be on the road to recovery. Something is wrong.

Once the haze of morphine clears, it does not take long for the Investigators to realise that a malevolence hangs over this hospital. They must overcome forces beyond human comprehension to save the pitiful few they can. Some, however, may not want to be saved.

The Investigators will quickly discover that there are worse things in this life than a bullet wound.

Not so Quiet is the newest adventure from established Call of Cthulhu writer Adam Gauntlett.

84628.description:
Fallout: New Vegas takes place during the year 2280, three years after the events of Fallout 3, and 203 years after the Great War of 2077, making this installment chronologically the latest in the series thus far. The game is set in post-apocalyptic Las Vegas, Nevada and the Mojave Desert. Landmarks featured in Fallout: New Vegas include the Hoover Dam that supplies power to the city and the Helios 1 solar energy plant. Unlike other cities in the Fallout series, Las Vegas was not struck directly by a nuclear attack. Its buildings remain intact, and mutation of its inhabitants is minimal.

The game places the player in the role of a courier, found in a shallow grave after being shot in the head and left for dead by the leader of a crime family. The Courier is rescued by a robot who brings him to a doctor. After treating the courier's injuries, the player enters into character creation (defining skills and attributes, name, gender, age and appearance) and begins investigating the assassination attempt and recovering the stolen package, as well as exploring the post-apocalyptic world.

Various in-game equipment kits are available as pre-order bonuses: Depending on which retailer the player purchases through, the style of armor and additional gear granted will be different.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fallout: New Vegas", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogameexpansion: Fallout: New Vegas – Gun Runners' Arsenal
Fallout: New Vegas – Old World Blues

84629.name: Thrust
videogameversion: English/European BBC Micro Electron 'Cassette' edition (Blue Ribbon re-release)
84629.description:
User Summary

In Thrust you fly a spaceship behind enemy lines to steal pods which, apparently, will power the more powerful ships of your side, once you make it back alive.

It's an arcade cave flying game. What it sets it apart from games like Scramble is two things: that in this game there is gravity and you have to use your tractor beam to steal a pod. The pod then sort-of connects to your space craft like a trailer, greatly impacting it's flying behaviour, in combination with the gravity.

On higher levels the gravity is reversed, refreshing the challenge.

84630.name: Svoyi Koziri
84630.description:
Russian card game of attacking and getting rid of all cards. Originally a game for two, three or four players, it's mostly known today in an adapted version for two players brought into England by the Mathematics professor A.S. Besikovitch, and later included in David Parlett's Oxford Guide to Card Games. This version is played with exposed cards and symmetrical hands, giving it a strong strategic flavour.

At the beginning of the (Besikovitch) game each player chooses two sets without overlapping with the other player, typically in a 32-card deck, out of which one is their own trump. Cards are dealt for the first player, who keeps the cards of their both sets; the second player gets exactly the same cards in the other sets and both their hands are filled up with the rest of the cards. As an example: a player who's chosen spades and clubs with spades as trumps keeps the cards in both sets and gives all their red cards together with the undealt cards to the other player, who then selects the analog cards to the first player's in the red sets with hearts as trumps, gives the rest of the red cards back to the first player and finally keeps all the remaining black cards. Both hands are symmetrical, and play can start.

From now on each turn a player lays a card in a pile between both players; before the next player can play out a card of their choice they must throw one that is superior in value to the top card in the pile or a trump. If the player can't or doesn't want to do so they must take the whole pile and forfeit the turn. So, each player throws two cards in a row: one following the previous card, and one to be followed by the opponent. The first player to get rid of all cards in their hand is the winner.

84631.name: Rise of the Robots
84631.description:
From the back of the box (DOS):

Metropolis 4. A City-state dependent on robot-industry. A city under siege.
At Electrocorp, the largest manufacturer of military and industrial robots, a malignant Ego virus has corrupted the robot-workers' behavioral programming. A seductive sensation has been added to the newly created "Pleasure Center" in their CPU's. Its name: Destruction/Joy.
There is but one way to end the rampant evil. A champion must be found. You are chosen. Part man, part machine - you are the Cyborg. You must challenge the most aggressive robots ever engineered. Each equipped with artificial intelligence. Each capable of anticipating your every move. Each with only one objective. DESTROY.
You must battle five robot fighters of unparalleled strength and skill before squaring off against the ultimate challenger: the Supervior. Her speed and accuracy are lethal. Her evil, melting morphing ability, deadly.
Prepare for the most intense showdown ever!


One- and two-player modes
Original score by legendary rock guitarist Brian May
3-D visual contouring allows robots to exist in a realistic environment
Up to 100 frames of animation support fluid robot movements
Sophisticated punch detection matrix enhances playability
Artificial Intelligence allows robots to learn and anticipate, creating increasingly difficult fight sequences

84633.name: Hobgoblins of the Mailed Fist
rpgissuearticle: Tribes: Hobgoblins of the Mailed Fist
84633.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Equally renowned for their battle skills and mercenary hearts, the warriors of the Mailed Fist fight for anyone with the coin to pay them. Heavily armoured, disciplined and well trained those that stand below the Mailed Fist’s banner are formidable fighters capable of great slaughter. High above, their winged cavalry- elite warriors and battlecasters astride gigantic black bats- hurl missiles and spells down upon their hapless foes. Hobgoblins of the Mailed Fist includes:

Seven new feats

Four new spells

Three new magic items used by powerful tribal members

Fourteen stat blocks (ranging in CR from 2 - 11)

Full details of the tribe’s race of ancient allies, the black wings of Asgiroth

The Hobgoblins of the Mailed Fist can appear in almost any setting and are compatible with The Lonely Coast (a free 30-page, extensively bookmarked PDF).

84636.name: D.M. Graphic Cyclopedia
84636.description:
From Introduction:

From Allathandrac’s Wight to the Vile Zombie, the Dreaming Merchant Graphic Cyclopedia is an eclectic collection of creatures, spells, potions, magic items, arcane weapons, characters and scenarios to assist, inspire, and enhance the creation of memorable d20 campaigns. Within these pages are choice creations carefully harvested from over 40 years of
campaign design experience.

A few of the entries in the Cyclopedia are carefully crafted variations on the time-honored figures of the fantasy genre. However, most are cut from whole cloth. Unlike some d20 campaign aids, there is not a single item in this collection that is a simple copy of some nearly forgotten creature from the early days of role playing. We strove, throughout the Cyclopedia, to choose invention over cliche, and vivid illustration over quick, approximated sketches.

84637.name: Tombs!
84637.description:
From Introduction:

To adventurers, what lies within these ancient tombs holds more importance than their appearance or the reason for their creation. Unless a tomb has already been ransacked, everything within will be very, very old, perhaps older than any kingdom now in existence. The original makers of the tombs, ages ago, placed these objects within. The older a tomb is, the more likely that it contains both great riches and powerful guardians. For a tomb to survive intact for so long, the guardians must have been puissant enough to crush all comers.

84638.name: 64th Street: A Detective Story
84638.description:
64th Street: A Detective Story (64番街 A DETECTIVE STORY) is a beat 'em up arcade game released by Jaleco in 1991.

The story starts out in a typical Double Dragon/Final Fight style setting at 64th Street with two protagonists: Rick (Anderson), a calm and intelligent, 35-year old professional private detective and manager of the detective agency; and Allen (Tombs), a 19-year old, reformed delinquent trained by Rick, who is "short-tempered and violent when angry". In the beginning of the plot, an evil corporation known as the Legacy organization, kidnapped the daughter of a mid-aged rich man and left him a letter explaining why they kidnapped her.

Late one night, before Rick and Allen was about to close their office, the mid-aged rich man, rushed inside the office while being exhausted. He asks for support on saving his daughter and gave the letter to Rick and Allen. The next day, Allen notices an advertisement in the classifieds with similar sentence structure to the letter left by the kidnappers. Rick couldn't understand it so easily, until Allen told him to look cautiously at both, the letter and the ad. They soon realize that the writing is actually a secret code, only understood by certain crime lords, so Rick and Allen struggled toward the main base of the Legacy organization to find the truth and save the kidnapped daughter. The setting later takes on a steampunk feel as it goes along, coming to a head in a battle inside a blimp.

Source: Wikipedia, "64th Street: A Detective Story", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84639.name: Power Displays (Expanded)
84639.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are different default displays that accompany powers - auditory, material, visual, etc. There are even rules to change a category of display for a character. But what if you want more than just those options? What if you want your kineticist's visual displays on his fire powers to make him look like he's covered in a wreath of fire, while the visual displays on his cold powers make him look like his breath is frost? What if you want your seer's offensive powers with a mental display to remind those nearby of the feeling of being ill?

These are the rules presented in High Psionics: Power Displays. With new displays, display groups, character themes, and more, this supplement helps you truly customize your manifester's unique personality. With 11 full pages of new power displays, every manifester type has new options for their powers.

84640.name: Soulknives
84640.description:
From publisher blurb:

ield the true power of a mind blade with this new supplement for d20 psionics!

Included in the pages of High Psionics: Soulknives you will find:

4 variant soulknives
Over a dozen new feats
And a variety of new psionic items to augment and enhance the mind blade.




In addition, for those who use the variant soulknife presented in Untapped Potential: New Horizons in Psionics, rules are also given to easily incorporate these new variant options.

84645.name: Arm Wrestling
84645.description:
Arm Wrestling is a 1985 arcade game developed and released only in North America by Nintendo and a spin-off of the Punch-Out!! series. Since it was created by the same development team who made the Punch-Out!! series, Arm Wrestling features many of the same features such as a dual monitor system and quirky computer opponents. It was Nintendo's last arcade game they independentally developed and released. The game was almost exclusively released overseas, with only a few machines available in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arm Wrestling (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84646.name: Circus Charlie
84646.description:
Circus Charlie (サーカスチャーリー Sākasu Chārī) is an action/platform game originally released by Konami in which you control a clown named Charlie. The game was a hit arcade game in 1984, which also had a successful release on the MSX in 1984, the Nintendo Famicom in 1986 by Soft Pro and on the Commodore 64 in 1987. It was released along with other Konami classic games on the Nintendo DS compilation Konami Classics Series: Arcade Hits.

Source: Wikipedia, "Circus Charlie", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84647.name: Times of Lore
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
84647.description:
From the back of the box

Long ago, High King Valwyn drove back the barbarian hordes invading Albareth, ending a tragic war. Drained of spirit, he departed to renew his strength in the Elden homelands. Legends promised his return after 20 years.

But twenty years have come and gone, and Valwyn has not returned. The mystic powers of old are fading, and chaos rules the land. Desperate brigands roam the once-peaceful roads, while the fearful citizens of Albareth live in a world without law.

Dauntless adventurers are being sought for dangerous quests in this intriguing land from the Times of Lore

Welcome to the Kingdom of Albareth!

Experience a game with captivating action and unprecedented levels of graphic detail. Stroll along the seashore, lulled by the rolling tide or explore long-forgotten desert ruins. Measure your strength; test your courage. Challenge death with sword in hand, for these are the Times of Lore!

Times of Lore combines real-time actiobn with an epic story of adventure and intrigue, with challenges never before seen in a fantasy role-playing game!

User addition
Times of Lore is a top down action RPG. The player can choose one of three characters to adventure with: the strong barbarian, the armored knight or the nimble valkyrie. Fighting is realtime and dialogue is handled through key-phrases of which to choose. Atmospheric music from Martin Galway.

84648.name: Nastar Warrior
84648.description:
Rastan Saga II (ラスタンサーガ2), known in Europe as Nastar and in North America as Nastar Warrior (except for the North American Sega Mega Drive/Genesis version, which was known as Rastan Saga II) is a hack and slash platform arcade game developed and released by Taito in 1988. It is the sequel to Rastan Saga (released simply as Rastan in North America).

A side scrolling hack-and-slash-em-up where you take the role of a barbarian who tries to defeat the evil wizard.

Source: Wikipedia, "Rastan Saga II", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84650.name: Capharnaüm
84650.description:
Capharnaüm is a french role playing game.

from the publisher website

english:

The mark of dragons that you have in the back, proves it: you are an uncommon being. As heirs of dragons, you are destined to live great adventures and write world history. The Seal Dragon is there, on your skin, you must accept this fate, or the face.

In a world of mystery and magic of the loan and exotic delicacies from the East, a wonderful land tanned by the sun and sip the blood of peoples, your destiny awaits you ... will you measure up? Get ready to travel the world to unravel plots and conspiracies, to confront the evil of jinn and defeat many enemies. And who knows, maybe one day, your star will shine does in heaven ...

french:

La marque des dragons, que vous avez dans le dos, l’atteste : vous êtes un être hors du commun. En tant qu’Héritier des dragons, vous êtes destiné à vivre de grandes aventures et à écrire l’histoire du monde. Le sceau draconique est là, sur votre peau, il vous faut accepter ce destin, ou l’affronter.
Dans un monde de mystères et de magies emprunt de l’exotisme et des douceurs de l’Orient, sur une terre merveilleuse tannée par le soleil et gorgée du sang des peuples, votre destin vous attend... serez-vous à la hauteur ?

Préparez-vous à parcourir le monde, à dénouer intrigues et complots, à affronter la malice des djinns et à défaire de nombreux ennemis. Et qui sait, un jour peut-être, votre étoile brillera-t-elle dans les cieux...

84652.name: Sensible World of Soccer '96/'97
84652.description:
User Summary:

A conversion/update of the classic "Sensible World of Soccer", developed by Kuju & featuring online multiplayer.

84653.name: Feeding Frenzy 2: Shipwreck Showdown
84653.description:
User Summary:

A sequel to the popular Popcap game, "Feeding Frenzy 2" is an arcade game based around eating bigger & bigger fish up the "foodchain" in the ocean.

84654.name: Lindenstraße
84654.description:
This is a TV tie-in with the popular eponymous German TV series.

Players move around the board trying to collect 1 chip from each of the 6 houses on the street. To collect a chip, a player has to answer a question concerning the show correctly. After collecting all 6 chips, the player needs to answer a master question correctly to win.

There are several inbuilt variants for more or less competitive/cut-throat play.

84656.name: Battlefield 1943
videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)
videogamehonor: 2009 Spike Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2010 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
84656.description:
User Summary:

"Battlefield 1943" is an online multiplayer online team based first person shooter, set in the Pacific during World War 2. It takes the familiar online gameplay mechanics of Battlefield 1942 to consoles, using the Frostbite engine developed by DICE.

The game is online only & available through Sony & Microsoft's online stores. At the time of its release, it was the fastest selling download only title, selling over 600,000 copies within two weeks.

84657.name: Wacky Races (NES)
84657.description:
Wacky Races (チキチキマシン猛レース-, Chiki Chiki Machine Mou Race) was an Atlus platformer for the NES. (A Game Boy Color/Dreamcast/PC/PlayStation/PlayStation 2 game of the same name came out in 2000, but was published by Infogrames and was a racing game.) The game is based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon Wacky Races, starring Muttley and Dick Dastardly. In 2008, a version for the Wii was released, but it was a shooting game.

Gameplay

The player controls Muttley through three different areas (Hip Hop, Splish Splash and Go Go America) in typical platform action. By collecting 100 diamonds, Muttley gains an extra life and by finding a bone, Muttley can switch out another one of his weapons, adding a slight strategy element to the game

Source: Wikipedia, "Wacky Races (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84658.name: Yslandia
84658.description:
Dive into the heart of the Yslandia universe, a subscription-free MMORPG. With its innovative game play, finely detailed graphics, and an addictive soundtrack, Yslandia has been ranked number one in France for role-playing games since its release. Wage battles in real time in a conflict where 6 races are vying for the possession of a group of magnificent islands, each with its own unique characteristics.

Create one or more characters from a large selection and embark on an exhilarating adventure!

Through hundreds of quests and regular ingame events, discover a rich universe populated by colorful characters and unusual creatures. Explore, fight, trade and collect rare items for the glory of your clan!

Advance on your own or with a team and lead epic battles and duels in real time.

Control the advancement of your character and learn to master spells and new fighting techniques. Compete in the race for totems, control Yslandia’s territory and defend the glory of your clan! (The more totems your clan controls, the greater the glory in PvP and RvR).

Invite your friends to be part of your guild, control their characters when they’re offline and exchange knowledge and items with them.

Proud adventurers, become a legend through the OpenFeint worldwide rankings and join thousands of other players in the world of Yslandia!

Yslandia and its many challenges steadfastly await you!

Source: The Game Website.

84659.name: Galaga Legions DX
84659.description:
User Summary:

"Galaga Legions" follows in the footsteps of Namco's other HD updates/remixes of its classic arcade games. It takes the familiar Galaga gameplay, updates it with a futuristic neon infused look, and adds a bunch of gimmicks to the core gameplay.

Played over a series of waves, players are given warning of the direction of incoming enemies. Although the player's ship can only shoot forward, players can place stationary turrets that shoot in one of four directions in an attempt to deal with the variety of directions enemies can attack from.

84660.name: Danger Mountain
84660.description:
Author's Description:
Danger Mountain! emulates disaster films from the 1970s, which capitalized on a growing environmental malaise and blended it with age-old B-movie melodrama. The results were roundly terrible in retrospect, but terrible in a really fun way.

Danger Mountain! was written by Jason Morningstar in September 2010 for Game Chef 2010. The contest theme was journey and the ingredients were edge, desert, and city.

84662.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Module Y3 comprises a 100-page SSD book, including:
Early battleships for the Federation, Kzintis, and Gorns.

Warp-refitted command cruisers for the rest of the Federation member states before the unified star fleet was formed.

Warp-driven dreadnoughts for the five member species of the Inter-Stellar Concordium before they coalesced into one nation.

The 64-page rulebook includes five scenarios as well as the ship descriptions and annexes.
84662.name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Y3 – Early Years III
boardgameexpansion: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

84663.name: Lost Complete Victory: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
boardgamefamily: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles
84663.description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.

84664.description:
This is a Japanese science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes.

Seven scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 10 to 20 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The outcome is decided by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
84664.name: Vermilion: Legend of the Galactic Heroes
boardgamefamily: Legend of the Galactic Heroes fleet battles

84665.name: The Smurfs
videogameversion: EU Game Boy (Super Game Boy compatible) edition
84665.description:
The Smurfs is a platform game based on the popular eponymous series. Released by Infogrames in 1994 for home consoles and in 1997 for Windows, it was one of the few games available in more than one language, selectable by the player. A Game Boy Advance version was released in 2002, under the title "Revenge of The Smurfs" The PAL version specifically could be played in either English, French, Spanish, German and Italian.
Source: Wikipedia, "The Smurfs (Infogrames)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

It should be noted that the 16-bit version the first level is different; the player starts in the smurf village rather than the forest.

84666.name: Fenix (Volume 7, Issue 5 - Sep 2010)
84666.description:
To the largest part this issue contains RPG related articles, including material for the games Coriolis, Saga and Operation Fallen Reich.

Also included is a complete RPG "Fasettögats hemlighet".

Contents (in Swedish)

3 Ledare
6 Nyhetssvepet Vad nytt på spelfronten?
7 Neogames tar över Svenska rollspel får en gemensam och engagerad distributör
8 Svenska rollspel - döda eller levande? Fenix tar pulsen på den svenska rollspelshobbyn
10 Rollspelstillverkare Vad har de svenska rollspelskreatörerna på gång och hur ser de på hobbyn?
18 Rollspel i spelbutiker Vad säljer och hur kan man öka försäljningen?
20 Rollspel på konvent Står rollspelen i fokus, eller får de inte plats?
22 Vad vill Sverok? Spelförbundet ger sin syn på rollspelshobbyn och debatten.
23 Rollspel är unika Vad är det utmärkande draget som förenar alla rollspel?
26 Smugglarnas planet Coriolis - Horisontens ände fortsätter bygga ut spelvärlden.
31 Fasettögats hemlighet Nils Hintze har gjort en uppföljare till den uppskattade bilagan Himlastorm i Fenix nr 5, 2009.
44 Den försvunne baronen Saga - Ett äventyr med maktkamp och intriger.
48 Picnic in poland 2: Operation Fallen Reich Kommer rollpersonerna att utlösa andra världskriget när de möter SS Kommando Amon Göth?
52 Recensioner
57 Soundtracks och pdf-äventyr Pelgrane Press har även gett ut stämningsmusik och pdf-äventyr till sina spel Esoterrorists och Trail of Cthulhu..
68 Butiksguiden

84667.name: Real Heroes: Firefighter
84667.description:
User Summary

This alternative take on the FPS genre puts the player in the role of a Rookie Firefighter. Wii motion controls and fps elements combine to provide a fun and engaging firefighting "simulation".

84668.name: Boogie
84668.description:
Boogie is a music video game developed by Electronic Arts for the Wii, PlayStation 2 and Nintendo DS. Being touted as a party-game, it enables players to create their character, then use the Wii Remote and a microphone to sing and dance through it. Each song within the game can be performed either as a karaoke or as a dancing game. The game is based around an alien theme. It was one of the first games released in Brazil for the Wii. .

Source: Wikipedia, "Boogie (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84669.name: Boogie SuperStar
84669.description:
Like the original game, Boogie Superstar features both singing and dancing. The game is based around the premise of a talent contest.

The karaoke gameplay is similar to other singing games such as SingStar and Karaoke Revolution. To score, the player must sing in time and in tune with the lyrics as they scroll at the bottom of the screen, with a musical staff to indicate the correct pitch and where the player's current pitch is. Rather than using phonetic detection, the game bases the score on how well the player matches the rhythm and pitch.

In contrast to the freestyle dancing in the last game, the game mechanic in Boogie Superstar involves players waggling the Wii Remote to simple two-beat prompts, such as swinging the Remote side-to side or up and down in time to on screen directions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Boogie Superstar," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2011 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
84671.description:
The "game board" is set up in the box - four poles are put in the corners which have plateaus on them. Each player gets a catapult (seesaw-style), four actual fluffy pillows and three cardboard figurines of their color.

The active player puts a pillow on his/her catapult and tries to lob it into the box. If successful, he/she may put one figurines on one of the plateaus. If one of these is shot down, he/she takes it back and also takes one pillow out of the box. The first player to get all four pillows into the box is the winner.
84671.name: Kissenschlacht

84672.name: Mutsu Nikki
boardgameexpansion: Dokuganryu Masamune
84672.description:
This is self-published expansion kit for Dokuganryu Masamune. Also needs rulebook and reference card from Hideyoshi Gunki or later.
"Mutsu Nikki" means "Record of Mutus province".

Covering battles of Mutsu and Dewa province.
Six scenarios are included in this kit.
"Battle of Eiroku 1", "Battle of Eiroku 2", "punitive expedition　to Ooura" and "Battle of Minato" are short games for two players.
"Three champions of Dewa" is short game for three players.
"Mutsu Nikki"　is campaign game for three or four players.

84674.name: Billy the Wizard: Rocket Broomstick Racing
84674.description:
In the game, the player races alongside other wizards in the Broomstick Grand Prix. The game involves the player blasting opponents out of the sky with their magical powers, and collecting extra ammunition as they skim tree-tops and plunge under low bridges and archways.

The game has over 40 stages spread across 5 levels, with 8 playable characters to choose from.

Source: Wikipedia, "Billy the Wizard: Rocket Broomstick Racing", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84676.name: Rappelz
84676.description:
Rappelz is a free-to-play massively multiplayer online role-playing game. The game is developed by the Korean company Gala Labs, formerly nFlavor, and published by the Californian company Gala-Net Inc.

Rappelz is set in a medieval fantasy world, dominated by three races: the Deva, who represent light, the Asura, who represent darkness, and the Gaia, humans that possess an affinity with nature.

Each major installment of the game is referred to as an "Epic", similar to Lineage II's "Chronicles". The current installment is called "Epic VII: Awakening".

Source: Wikipedia, "Rappelz", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84677.name: Sengoku Gunyuden supplement kit
boardgameexpansion: Shingen Joraku
84677.description:
This is expansion kit for Shingen Joraku. also needs Kanto Seiatsu, Nobunaga Fuun-roku, Hideyoshi Gunki, The Longest Day in Sengoku.

Covering battles of Oda-Tkugawa ally versus Takeda clan.
Two scenarios are included in this kit.
"Shingen's Last Battle 2nd Edition" is expansion version of "Shingen Joraku. Large campaign scenario for two players. One player control Takeda clan, Hojo clan and western coalition. Another player control Oda clan, Tokugawa clan and Uesugi clan.
"Battle of Nagashino - Nobunaga's Victory" is short game for two players.

84678.name: RoboCop 2 (C64, NES)
videogamehonor: 1991 Golden Joystick Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner (8-bit)
84678.description:
RoboCop 2 is a series of video games published in the 1990s by Ocean and Data East for various home computers and video game consoles. They are based on the movie of the same name. Three different games were produced, each produced on two systems.

The version for the Commodore 64 and NES was a simple left-to-right scrolling platformer, in which RoboCop was required to collect/destroy at least two-thirds of the drug "nuke" in each level and arrest two-thirds of the suspects by running into them (in contrast to shooting them). If RoboCop does not manage to attain the required amounts of nuke or number of arrests then he has two chances in the game to prove his efficiency at a shooting range. If he succeeds, he may continue onto the next level. If he fails, or if both chances at the shooting range are already used up, he must repeat the level.

Source: Wikipedia, "RoboCop (video games)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84679.name: RoboCop 3
84679.description:
The NES edition of RoboCop 3 is a traditional single-player, side-scrolling game with a storyline and background that loosely follows the film. A unique, memorable feature is the fact that each of RoboCop's body parts has a separate damage rating. Heavily damaged parts can result in "malfunctions," such as erratic firing (if the arm holding the weapon is damaged) or difficulty walking (if legs are damaged). The player has the opportunity to repair RoboCop's parts between levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "RoboCop (video games)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84680.name: Paths of the Resolute
84680.description:
Author's Description:
Paths of the Resolute is a game about finding personal identity amidst chaos. In this game, the players will play people who have lost their identity in a catastrophe, but struggle to create a new one in order to survive annihilation.

Entry in the 2010 Game Chef Design Contest.

84681.name: The 7 Symbols of San Rio
84681.description:
Author's Blurb:
The 7 Symbols of San Rio is an Oracle Style game in which the players are stuck in an abandoned city in the middle of a desert with some brand new tattoos and a note addressed to them. There is a push towards exploring the meaning of Sin and Virtue in this environment.

Entry in the 2010 Game Chef Design Contest.

84682.name: A Trick of the Light
84682.description:
From the introduction:
A Trick of the Light is a roleplaying game for four players. At least one of them is playing the role of a real person who traveled to the ruins at the center of the desert. The others may be real humans, ghosts of people who died along the way, or ancient spirits, good or evil, that have resided in the ruined city for generations. To pass the time as you wait for rescue, you have chosen to tell stories about the journey that led you here. As you tell and listen to these tales, you will slowly gain insights, about yourself and your companions. In the end, if you are real and alive, you will need to make a decision about who can be trusted. If you are a spirit, you will need to lead the living to a decision, good or bad depending on your nature. And if your are a ghost, you will need to name your killer, and hope to serve vengeance or support the innocent.

Designer listed as Jeff R.

Entry in the 2010 Game Chef Design Competition.

84683.name: Pub Crawl: Take the Edge Off
rpg: Pub Crawl: Take the Edge Off
84683.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Recently, you and your friends participated in a semi-annual event in your city: the pub crawl. There were good times, there were bad times and, as is often the case, now you’re all sitting around swapping stories from that day. Who wouldn’t laugh remembering the blush on Penelope’s face when she realized that the bartender offering her a virgin mimosa wasn’t commenting on her sex life? And all the guys wince every time Tex points out that he got hit in the junk with a baseball bat while defending Bambi.

Since alcohol was involved, you’re going to need some help from your friends to remember the details of what happened that day.

Entry in 2010 Game Chef Design Competition

84685.name: M.I.S.S.I.O.N.
84685.description:
"Adventures in Espionage Roleplaying."

MISSION: ACQUIRE PLANS

From the back of the box:

You approach the island swimming silently, carefully avoiding the patrols by diving deeper. When you reach the island, you frantically bury your gear in the sand before you crawl through the thick grass to the fence. Cutting through the fence is easy, but your heart stops when your foot scuffs some dirt onto the last mine in the field. Avoiding the searchlight, you sprint to the building and enter. After neutralizing the alarms, you penetrate the security zone. Locating and photographing the plans is almost too easy ... Oh no ... a guard

Contents:

7 - 17.5 by 23 full color maps
4 - 17.5 by 23 interior building floor plans
4 - 8.5 by 11 full color card stock building interior floor modules
1 Book of rules

videogame: Galactic Civilizations II: Twilight of the Arnor
84686.name: Galactic Civilizations II: Endless Universe
videogamecompilation: Galactic Civilizations II: Twilight of the Arnor
84686.description:
User summary:

Galactic Civilizations 2: Endless Universe is an award winning space strategy game. This comprehensive epic story takes place after the events in Dark Avatar and Twilight of the Arno.

Two new challenging campaigns offer you the opportunity to control new advanced units, explore exciting maps and planetary environments, experience the delight of enhanced graphics, and immerse into countless hours of gaming, in a quest to conquer the universe.

84687.name: Sonic Mega Collection
84687.description:
User Summary

Sonic Mega Collection is a compilation of games, most of them from the Sonic the Hedgehog franchise, for the Nintendo Game Cube. It contains fewer games than the related compilation Sonic Mega Collection Plus.

84688.name: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye Small Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Cars: Radiator Springs Rallye
84688.description:
Small expansion for the base game:

It comes with 4 new cars:
Ramone
Luigi
Guido
The King

Allows now the game to played up to 10 players.

And adds a new route as well called: "Even Longer". (Just adds 2 more tiles, with Luigi and The King special places.)

84689.name: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
84689.description:
User Summary

Monty Python's The Meaning of Life is an adventure game based loosely on the film of the same name. It features surreal humor and puzzles, and it is interspersed with video footage from the movie.

84691.name: Franko The Crazy Revenge!
84691.description:
The story of this game revolves around years 1987-1989 during the political changes in Poland (from communism to capitalism) in Polish city Szczecin. Main character's friend - Alex - was attacked by some random bald guy and knocked out, when Franko decided to strike the guy back, guy's "friends" appeared and kicked the s**t out of him...

Thus begun holy quest of walking through the not-so-pretty block of flats districts of Polish city and killing everything that moves (including all popular sub-cultures of the '80s, judo fighters, as well as police, MO and ZOMO officers). You can choose one of two available characters: Franko or Alex (even though according to game story the latter got killed - slight mishap) that differ in strengst and fighting style.

There are 3 major bosses at the end of each stage, between stages you move by driving Fiat126p (the car called "Maluch" - the icon of Polish pop-culture of that time). Story of the game reveals some smuggling affairs (Szczecin is a harbour-city) as well as the events of political transformation as the game goes by.

Source: User Summary and Wikipedia, "Franko The Crazy Revenge!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84692.name: Savage XCom
84692.description:
Author Blurb:
Based on X-Com: UFO Defense/UFO: Enemy Unknown it is a war between a special forces organization and aliens. Can you survive and turn back the alien menace?

84693.name: Savage Wuxia!
84693.description:
From the introduction:
Wuxia is a very broad genre of Chinese fiction focusing on the adventures of martial-arts heroes. Many modern kung-fu movies trace their origins to Wuxia. The heroes are usually independent, living as wanderers or rebels, following a code of honor to protect innocents from oppression. Most are martial-arts masters and some have quasi-mystical powers. Supernatural beings and evil sorcerers are present in many Wuxia stories. In short, these are the Eastern equivalent of swords & sorcery or the picaresque novel.

Traditional Wuxia focuses on common people of great skill, following the warrior's code to defend helpless innocents from evil overlords, crime bosses, vile sorcerers, and unnatural monsters. Often, a tangled soap-opera-like web of enemies, allies, and departed lovers envelops the hero, pulling him or her into adventure from multiple angles. A recurring theme in Wuxia is the conflict between love (or other personal relationships and goals) and duty (acting honorably and for the cause of good), so select Hindrances that play into these contradictory motivations.

The rules presented here provide a modern, cinematic kung-fu experience. They are meant to encourage energetic, mobile combat, and to balance unarmed and weapon styles.

84694.name: Wrath of Zombie
84694.description:
From the introduction:
I just want to say thanks to anyone who even has taken a peek at this to see if it is worth a damn! When making this game, I honestly made it for me and then decided to share it with others. There are several great zombie games out there and this is not a project saying that I can do it better, merely I love Savage Worlds, and there wasn’t a zombie game for it that
had everything that I was looking for.

You may find yourself looking through this and saying, "Hey! This is EXACTLY like something from this zombie movie!" or game or whatever. And guess what, you are probably right. I borrowed from many zombie and survival horror movies, books, games, comics, or whatever. I’ve taken things I’ve enjoyed about the genre and plopped them all into this campaign setting. At the end of this booklet I give a full list of all the things that have influenced my setting. On that note, a hearty thank you to all those who have worked so hard to create some amazing pieces of art in the zombie and survival horror genre! We would not have our love for the hordes of undead or the tingling sensation down our back without your love and care!

Soooo.. What do you need to play Wrath of Zombie©? Just this little thing here and Savage Worlds Explorer’s Edition (SWEX)!
Note: Having the Savage Worlds Adventure deck can add some fun to your Wrath of Zombie© game, but isn’t necessary.

I hope you enjoy it and have some fun with it! If not, oh well. I tried!

84695.name: Hannah Montana: The Movie
84695.description:
What's a secret rock star to do?

Miley Stewart finds out it's not easy to get the best of both worlds. Join Miley Stewart as she finds herself back in her hometown of Crowley Corners, a world away from the glamorous rockstar life of Hannah Montana!

In Walt Disney Pictures Presents Hannah Montana: The Movie video game, you'll get to experience Miley Stewart's secret dual-life. You'll explore Crowley Corners to complete quests and unlock key props needed to throw amazing Hannah Montana concerts! Then, you'll get to use the props to rock out in Hannah Montana concerts.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hannah_Montana:_The_Movie_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84696.name: Zanac
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
84696.description:
Zanac (ザナック) is an arcade-style shoot 'em up video game designed by Compile and published in Japan by Pony Canyon and in North America by FCI. It was released for the MSX computer, the Family Computer Disk System, the Nintendo Entertainment System, and for the Virtual Console. It was reworked for the MSX2 computer as Zanac Ex and for the PlayStation as Zanac X Zanac. Players fly a lone starfighter, dubbed the AFX-6502 Zanac, through twelve levels; their goal is to destroy the System a part-organic, part-mechanical entity bent on destroying Mankind.

Zanac was developed by main core developers of Compile, including Masamitsu "Moo" Niitani, "Janus" Teramoto, and "Jemini" Hirono. All of these developers went on to make other popular similarly-based games such as The Guardian Legend, Blazing Lazers, and the Puyo Puyo series. The game is known for its intense and fast-paced gameplay, level of difficulty, and music which seems to match the pace of the game. It has been praised for its unique adaptive artificial intelligence, in which the game automatically adjusts the difficulty level according to the player's skill level and rate of fire.

History

Zanac was initially released in 1986 for the MSX computer by the Japanese video game company Compile the same company responsible for other games such as Blazing Lazers, Devil's Crush, and the Puyo Puyo series. Compile then re-released the game for the MSX2 computer later that same year as Zanac Ex, which featured improved graphics and sound over the original MSX version. Zanac was then ported and heavily reworked again for release on the Family Computer Disk System in Japan on November 28, 1986 (1986-11-28), and then in North America for the NES in October 1987. The NES version was later re-released for Wii's Virtual Console service on December 3, 2007 (2007-12-03) and published by D4 Enterprise. This version is identical to the NES version released in 1987.

Compile released a compilation titled Zanac X Zanac for Sony's PlayStation console in Japan on November 29, 2001 (2001-11-29) to commemorate the 15th anniversary of the original. This compilation features an updated version of Zanac titled Zanac Neo and three versions of the NES version of the game, including a version featuring enhanced graphics and sound. The game features two-player cooperative gameplay as well as a remix of the game's soundtrack.

Zanac, in retrospect, has been considered a unique shoot 'em up game, combining gameplay elements from games such as Xevious, especially with the extensive power-up system and vertical-scrolling gameplay that features both air and ground targets. Brett Alan Weiss of Allgame praised Zanac, calling it an extremely fast-paced shooter in which the player is almost completely surrounded by enemy ships and bullets. He praises the game for its music which seems to flow along with the action of the game; he calls the music "at least as close as you can get to a Zen moment while playing a shooting game on the NES". Frank Provo of GameSpot lauded Zanac for its difficulty level, its ability to handle many sprites on the screen without slowdown or other glitches, and its unique AI, which placed this game in a sub-genre of its own. However, criticisms include mediocre and primitive music and sound, a steep learning curve in gameplay and difficulty level, and, most notably, presence of Engrish in the game itself and in the game's instruction manual. In addition, Weiss says that enemies in Zanac, while fearsome, "don't have much personality."

Source: Wikipedia, "Zanac", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84698.name: Savage Westeros
84698.description:
User Summary:
Web-published conversion of the Game of Thrones setting to the Savage Worlds! rpg.

From the notes: You will need the Savage Worlds (Revised Second Edition) Rulebook as well as the Fantasy Gear Toolkit and Fantasy World Builder Toolkit to make full use of this free download.

84699.name: Savage Weird War II
84699.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to my conversion notes for Pinnacle Entertainment Group Inc.’s Weird War II: Blood on the Rhine (WWII:BotR). Everything in here will be in the order in which it is found in that resource. I utilized Pinnacle’s d20 Conversion notes, Screenmonkey’s Weird Wars conversion notes at Savage Heroes and the Bats scenario by Teller that was released on the Pinnacle Website.

84700.name: GameMastery Encounter: Death Shrine of the Ninja Cult (OGL)
84700.description:
from the publiser website

No secrets escape the legendary death shrine of the ninja cult, a den of silent assassins and profane traditions. However, a line has at last been crossed, and the cult must be brought to justice. A Compleat Encounter, scalable to any level, featuring a masked ninja princess and male and female ninja champions.

84701.name: GameMastery Encounter: Throne of the Gorilla King (OGL)
84701.description:
from the publisher website

Delve deep into the fecund jungle, where the Silverback King rules with a wise majesty and an iron sword. Some say his lair sparkles with the gems of fallen empires, but few can match his ferocity in battle. A Compleat Encounter, scalable to any level, featuring the gorilla king and his monkey servitors.

84702.name: GameMastery Encounter: The Liberation of Prince Thorgrim (OGL)
84702.description:
from the publisher website

Prince Thorgrim rots in jail, wrongly accused by the corrupt sheriff and his cruel gaoler. Whispered rumors speak that those in his keep are tortured and sometimes murdered. Only the truly brave or fantastically foolish would try to storm the jail and free the prince. A Compleat Encounter, scalable to any level, featuring the elven sheriff, the shackled dwarven prince, and his foul gaoler.

84703.name: GameMastery Encounter: Grove of the Mad Druid (OGL)
84703.description:
from the publisher website

Grasker has never been exactly "normal." Obsessed with the filth, decay, and corruption of the natural world, he has recently been exiled for violently defending the carrion pit that had been his home. Now withdrawn into the wilderness, he has slowly begun to transform the surrounding landscape into a perverted paradise of worms and rotting flesh. Can the PCs stop the corruption before it spreads through an entire forest?.

84704.name: GameMastery Encounter: Terror in the Chamber of Pain (OGL)
84704.description:
from the publisher website

Twisted and depraved beyond measure, The Seeker in Shadow wanders the planes inflicting pain and savage torture upon his hapless victims. Now, the heart of his perverted chapel, the Chamber of Pain, beats with the blood of his newest "guests" - and only the PCs can stop his evil once and for all.

84705.name: GameMastery Encounter: Dark Elf Sanctum (OGL)
84705.description:
from the publisher website

In a darkened chamber deep below the sunlit world, a diabolical dark elf priestess weaves rhymes of magic over an ancient portal arch. What foul entity answers her summons, and what will happen when it emerges into the world of man? A Compleat Encounter, scalable to any level, featuring a dark elf priestess, a summoning arch, and an otherworldly monstrosity.

84706.name: GameMastery Encounter: The Vault of the Whispering Tyrant (OGL)
84706.description:
from the publisher website

Ages ago, he swore that his rule would last forever, that the kingdom need never fear life without his protection. Now he lives on as a lich, issuing terrible decrees in a hoarse whisper through rotting teeth. A Compleat Encounter, scalable to any level, featuring a lich sovereign, his mummy queen, and the wretched soulstone.

84708.name: Modern Backdrops
84708.description:
from the publisher website

Modern Backdrops is a unique and exciting resource for the Modern d20 System gamemaster. This collection offers you a series of well-developed cities, each with its own unique history, information on the important people and places, maps of specific locations, and plot hooks to help jump-start your campaign and get your players involved. These cities were created with the FX game in mind, but the information provided for each city should be sufficient for any style of game to be set, successfully, inside the city limits.

84709.name: Thrilling Places
rpgissuearticle: Recommended Reading - There and Back Again and Blowing it up
84709.description:
from the publisher website

PLACES OF PERIL!

Pulp heroes often travel to the ends of the Earth seeking adventure, but even citybound masked crimebusters and reporters come across all sorts of interesting locales. Thrilling Places is a resource for Pulp Hero players and GMs describing over a dozen amazing places all around the world where your heroes can have amazing adventures. Do your heroes have the guts and skill to brave:

* the Grant Building, a possibly-haunted office building
* Pranamoltar, volcano city of the alien Mole Men
* the Island of the Pale White Lady, where an insidious cult worships a foul, ancient god
* Laussat Plantation, where a mad scientist performs fiendish experiments among the crumbling buildings
* K'hull Island, home to a strange tribe, living dinosaurs, and a gigantic gorilla
* the Pleistocene Plateau, a Siberian highland where the Ice Age still exists
* the Street of the Emerald Bird, a section of Chinatown with a dangerous secret
* Neos Themiscyra, African home of the last surviving Amazons
* the Pharoah Club, a swank nightclub with an Egyptian theme
* Schloss Eisenwolf, an old German castle that may contain a fabulous mystic artifact
* the Royale Viridian Theatre, a luxurious cinema with mob connections
* the Temple of the Dragon, where the Sanctified Elder teaches martial arts secrets to worthy students
* the tomb of Kemtehenraau-Khanu, an Egyptian sorcerer-priest served by an ancient order of followers
* Xinca-Hol, a lost city of giant bat-riding, blowgun-wielding Central American pygmies

Get ready for two-fisted adventure in the Thrilling Places!

84710.name: Emerald Mine 2
84710.description:
Back of the box

This is the successor of the hugely popular diamond collecting game Emerald Mine. The two-player option has been retained and a user-friendly editor has been included as well.

84711.name: Emerald Mine 3 Professional
84711.description:
User Summary

More of an addon really, this third installation of the famous Emerald Mine Series contains over a hundred fan-created levels to conquer.

84713.name: Aunt Arctic Adventure
84713.description:
User Summary

In this little platformer the player guides Charlie the chimp (and Pete the penguin in two-player mode) to rescue his aunt who has been taken to the Arctic to work as a circus performer.

84714.name: Geoff Capes Strongman
84714.description:
User Summary

In this game you play the title-giving strong man who has to tackle all sorts of strength exercises like bending an iron bar or pulling a truck.

From the Manual (BBC B Version)

In STRONGMAN you will have to take control of Geoff's body as he tries to complete each different event. You will also have total responsibility for the general condition and fitness of Geoff's body, trying to make sure that it is able to cope with the high demands each event will put on it, as well as having the stamina to get right through to the very end.

To help you with this Geoff's body has been divided into several different areas represented by MUSCLE ICONS.

Different events will use different muscles to a greater or lesser extent. For example, the arm muscles may be especially important during the log chop.

At the beginning of each game level you will have a TRAINING SESSION.

During training you can build up each muscle area ready for the six events to come.

If the gauge in any muscle area reaches zero, Geoff will collapse and you will have to start all over again.

84715.name: Ghost Hunters
84715.description:
The player controls a character (named Hunk Studbuckle) around the platform style screen using the keyboard or joystick. Uniquely, to attack the enemy, the player must temporarily use the cursor keys to move targeting cross-hairs to shoot ghosts and demons (in a similar manner to Operation Wolf), causing the character to stand still. This results in the player requiring to shoot the targets quickly and operate their character to move around the screen before more would appear. In addition to being able to walk, the character can also jump and climb ladders.
