In addition to enemies to be killed, the environment contains items that can be collected, including 'macho energy' top-ups and 'key' items that unlock further areas. The game is one of few available on the CPC and ZX Spectrum platforms to feature low resolution clips of human speech, although playing them was so CPU-intensive that the game was required to freeze for their duration.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ghost Hunters (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84716.description:
Expansion to Activity with 220 new cards. Themes: leisure and food

The gameboard and pawns are needed from one of the basic Activity games.
Most of the new cards have book-, film- or play titels (theatre, opera, music), fairy tales or poems to be guessed by the teams
Also tasks about art and architecture, everything around food and kitchen and last but not least - games are includet in this theme pack.
It's a real challenge, to "dance" or picture the title of a poem, you might have learned in school - but will your teammates remember it too?

The minimum age is specified with 12, but 30 to 40 is best "experience-level"
84716.name: Activity Superthema Freizeit und Essen
boardgameexpansion: Activity

84717.name: Savage Warhammer
84717.description:
User Summary:

A web-published conversion of Warhammer fantasy to the Savage Worlds! rpg system.

Author Blurb: Savage Warhammer: This conversion focuses on the careers and on magic.

84718.name: Savaged Warcraft
84718.description:
From the introduction:

What follows is a conversion of the Warcraft setting to the Savage Worlds rules. It provides little to no information as to setting, since it is so ably chronicled by both Blizzard Entertainment in the source information for their games, and by Sword and Sorcery Games in their World of Warcraft RPG World of Warcraft: The Roleplaying Game. I highly suggest this latter and its sourcebooks for background material. The intention of this conversion is to capture the feel and style of the world, not to emulate play of any of the computer games or the d20 RPG.

84719.name: Street Fighter: Wind and Water
84719.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to my conversion of the Street Fighter setting, using the incredible, ass-kicking, fu-power slinging Feng Shui rules. Within these pages, you will find everything you need to create a campaign of street fighters using the Feng Shui rules. Special rules for fighting styles, rankings on the street-fighting circuit, and stats for the sixteen legendary World Warriors. Also included are rules to make Feng Shui feel more like Street Fighter: light and heavy punches and kicks, dizzies, and tournament street fights where the guy goes down, shakes it off, and gets back up for "Round Two! Fight!"

I’ve avoided filling in backstory here. There are at least three variant takes on the story of Ryu, Ken and the other World Warriors, not including the movie (because nobody ever does, really). Each has its good points, and each has its own variations of style. With Feng Shui for backup, coming up with nefarious plans for Shadoloo should be a snap, and really, between that and an endless series of tournaments, challenges and grudge matches, you’ve got a kick-ass game of Street Fighter covered.

You won’t find the Feng Shui rules in here. It’s a perfectly good book, part of a perfectly good system, and if you don’t already have it, go out and buy it! If you care enough to find a fan-written Street Fighter game, I can virtually guarantee that you will find something to love in Feng Shui.

This game owes a massive debt of gratitude to White Wolf’s original Street Fighter Storytelling game. While it’s more than a bit dated, and has its moments of frustration and clunkiness, it’s still a wonderfully energetic and focused attempt to take on this larger-than-life world.

84720.name: The Matrix Iterations
rpg: Tri-Stat dX: Core Role-Playing Game System
84720.description:
From the introduction:
What is The Matrix Iterations?
Fortunately, unlike the Matrix itself, one can be told about The Matrix Iterations. It is a roleplaying game that allows players to explore the possibilities inherent in the Wachowski Brothers’ rich setting. It gives the players options for many stories, set before, during and after the events shown in the films and the computer game Enter the Matrix. In fact, it is possible with The Matrix Iterations to visit the era of previous iterations of the Matrix, as well as to explore the world after Neo’s sacrifice, which we glimpse briefly at the end of Matrix Revolutions.

The Matrix Iterations uses Guardians of Order’s Tri-Stat dX system. This universal game system is simple and elegant, yet complex enough to handle all the permutations we see in the Matrix movies, comics and games. This game functions at a d8 level, and uses 2d8 to resolve tests. For further information, please see the Tri-Stat dX rulebook Tri-Stat dX: Core System Role-Playing Game[/thing].

84721.name: The Battletech Compendium
84721.description:
From the Back of the Book:

A COMPILATION OF six years of detailed research, The BattleTech Compendium may well be the ultimate resource for the player. Clear and concise rules clarifications, battle demonstrations, and rules changes will help develop and streamline play. All the material from The Battletech Manual is presented in revised form, as well as additional rules for JumpShip and DropShip combat, 'Mech construction, and the latest discoveries concering the technology of the Star League and the invading Clans. Optional rules are included for miniature play, environmental effects on the battlefield, and more. Loaded with color photos, this Compendium gives the clearest picture yet of combat in the 31st century.

on the BGG domain The BattleTech Compendium

84722.name: Quanto
84722.description:
A computation game for 2-4 players from 8-14 years

Contents: 4 men, 4 boards - each showing a pair of scales with adjustable weight figures, 60 tiles showing weight units from 1-60, track with 22 spaces.

1. Zero! Each player adjusts his scale so that it shows zero.
2. Two! Each player draws two weight-tiles and puts one on each side of his scale. It is up to hom which tile goes on the left and which tile goes on the right.
3. Quanto! Players draw a third tile an can place it either on the right or left side of their scales.
4. Got it! The first player who succeeds in balancing his scale by adjusting the dials scores most points

84723.name: Die Bar-Bolz-Bande: Das Kartenspiel
84723.description:
Football simulation for 2 to 6 players. The game consists of defense cards, midfield cards, attack cards and action cards. Each move is started by playing a midfield card. The cards have a color code that determines which kinds of cards can be played next (i.e. an attack card (red) can only be played if the previous card contains a red color code). Attack cards also show a number of balls that has to be surpassed by the next player. A player who cannot counter an attack card catches a goal and has to take all the cards from the current stack; the last player to play an attack card before that takes a scoring card. When the card stack is used up, the player with most scoring cards is the winner.
Action cards can be used to reverse player order, pass an attack to the next player, etc.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

84724.name: Auf der schwäbschen Eisenbahn
84724.description:
A dice rolling game with a colour dice, little plastic goats in 4 colours and 4 trains for transportation.

Goal is, to transport the goats through the swabian country following an old popular folksong "Auf der schwäbschen Eisenbahn"

84725.name: Genghis Khan II: Clan of the Gray Wolf
84725.description:
The player is given the option to conquer either the country of Mongolia as Genghis Khan himself, or to play as a world leader and take over the known world of the time. Both conquests are made through the balance of economy, population, buying and selling manufactured goods, family relations, promoting and demoting generals, developing military, all in a turn-based fashion. All of these actions can happen only within a given amount of "turn points", so some actions are given priority while others are overlooked. The game also includes a turn-based battle sequence, allowing specific control to the player or delegated to a general.

Source: Wikipedia, "Genghis Khan II: Clan of the Gray Wolf," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84726.name: Operation Europe: Path to Victory 1939-1945
84726.description:
Operation Europe: Path to Victory is a multiplatform war game where one or two players can compete in World War II action. The object of the game is to fulfill any one of the military objectives for either the Axis or the Allied forces. Players engage in modern warfare around Western Europe, Eastern Europe, Central Europe, and North Africa.

This game uses abstract numbers and figures in the map view and saves the concrete illustrations of soldiers only when they lock horns on the battlefield or in an urban setting. Urban settings give a traditional 1930s view of housing and office buildings that provide extra protection for units that are guarding them. However, there are massive numbers to crunch and the lack of graphics help enhance the number crunching ability of game's artificial intelligence.

Source: Wikipedia, "Operation Europe: Path to Victory," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84727.name: Die kleine Hexe: nach dem Buch von Ottfried Preußler
84727.description: In this game - following the children's book of Ottfried Preußler with the same name, each player will play the little sorceress once. The little sorceress tries to break the evil witches operations. So she attempts to burn the grimoires and witches' brooms. That child, whichs acts best, will win.

84728.name: Peregrinus
84728.description:
The XVII. the king scented the plans of the noblemen conspiring against it in England on a century's waist, that down it wants to be repelled from the throne. He deprived all those, who were getting involved in a suspicion, of their title, their property and their name because of this. As a last opportunity, offered it to the ones driven into the exile in order for them to prove their innocence, that who gets into the utmost nook of his realm as the first, it proves it with his desperation, worthy that way, that gets back his goods taken away. Your rivals will make your road harder, save up at what more thalers, that give yourself to benefits and be able to hold back your adversaries.

Be the most resolute one and reach the aim, the long one and tiring one firstly on a road, defying the obstacles, that regain all that, from which falsely bereft!

Peregrinus is a game that is still under development and just before publishing. Consequently, the rules are not complete yet but are still changing. In the game you have to come up with different colour combinations with four cards, and you can proceed in the game with these combinations. You can collect money, points, action cards and treasures. All this will be converted into victory points at the end of the game. You can create obstacles for your opponents, and you can turn the action cards into your advantage but can also annoy your opponents with these cards.

The aim of the game is to collect the most VPs

84730.description:
Takkie Kakkie is always hungry! But what happens now? Bah! He poops on the sidewalk! Dogs naturally do not belong on there, so poop should be cleaned up.

Aim of the game

Collect the dog's feces in your shovel. The first player to three pieces on his or her shovel is the winner.

Game play

Put the dog in the middle of the table. Each player gets a shovel. The youngest player starts the game by rolling the dice. The symbols on the dice indicate what you should do. This mostly indicates how many times you can push the handle on the dog's leash. Each time you push it the poop gets closer to the end, when it drops out you get it and one point. When you have three points, you win the game. Other symbols on the dice tell you that you can't do anything on this turn or that you can switch shovels with another player.
boardgameversion: Ideal Games English edition with 'Game of The Year' Award
84730.name: Doggie Doo

84731.name: Nintendo 64 Controller
videogamehwversion: Banana Yellow Donkey Kong 64 Nintendo 64 Controller
84731.description:
The Nintendo 64 controller is the standard game controller included with the Nintendo 64. Released by Nintendo in late 1996 in Japan and North America, and 1997 in Europe, it features ten buttons, one digital (not analog) control stick and a directional pad, all laid out in a "M" shape.

Design

The controller for the Nintendo 64 was designed to be held in several different positions. It was designed around Super Mario 64. It could be held by the two outer grips, allowing use of the digital D-pad, right-hand face buttons and the "L" and "R" shoulder buttons (but not the "Z" trigger or analog stick). It could be also held by the center and right-hand grip, allowing the use of the single control stick, the right hand-buttons, the "R" shoulder button, and the "Z" trigger on the rear (but not the "L" shoulder button or D-pad). More often than not the analog stick was used in games while in some, both the control stick and directional pad could be interchangeable (ex: Mortal Kombat Trilogy). Very few games used the directional pad exclusively; two examples are the 3D puzzle game Tetrisphere and the side-scrolling platformer Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards.

The controller also included four "C buttons", which were originally intended to control the camera in the N64's three dimensional environments. However, since the pad only contained three other face buttons, the C-buttons often became assigned to ulterior functions. An example of this is The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, where the C-buttons can be assigned to secondary items and the "Z"-trigger is used to orient the camera.

European controllers have a special Ferrite core about 4 centimeters from the connector plug, to prevent the user from being shocked by the power being supplied to it by the system if the wires become exposed. It also acts as cable tensioner.

One game, Robotron 64, allowed one player to use two controllers to control an avatar. This way the game played like its predecessor, Robotron 2084. Star Wars Episode 1: Racer, GoldenEye 007 and Perfect Dark also used this set up for slightly different gameplay experiences (in terms of control, at least) compared to the standard single controller option.

The controller initially came in six colors (grey, black, red, green, yellow and blue) but other colors were released later, many of them coinciding with the release of a similarly color or designed system. Some of these others include: smoke black, watermelon red, jungle green, fire orange, ice blue, grape purple, and special edition colors like gold, atomic purple, extreme green, "Donkey Kong 64" banana bunch yellow, "Pokémon" blue/yellow and "Millenium 2000" platinum.

Analog stick

For many years, console designers and manufacturers ignored analog stick technology, instead preferring the digital D-pad. It was not until the emergence of 3D gameplay that the analog stick was put into widespread use.[citation needed] Using a D-pad in a 3D game greatly limits the players ability to accurately utilize 360° of motion. Some early 3D games like Resident Evil overcame this limitation by assigning the Left and Right directions on the D-pad to spin the character rather than make the character move in that direction.

However, with the prevalence of analog sticks, the aforementioned D-pad limitation was no longer an issue. Though the Nintendo 64 wasn't the first console to use an analog stick (the Vectrex was first), it did popularize the idea. Its release followed Sega's analog Mission Stick for Sega Saturn as well as Sony's Analog Joystick and was followed during the fifth generation by Sony's Dual Analog and Dual Shock controllers for the PlayStation system as well as Sega's 3D control pad for their Saturn system and the analog controller for their Dreamcast system.

The analog stick was prone to some long-term reliability issues. If used excessively, the stick became "loose", which means it will not fully return to center position, which may render gameplay more difficult by giving unintended, non-user input to the system. This loosening can be caused by rotating it intensively - a common practice in games like Mario Party where it offers an advantage for some mini-games. Excessive rotating of the analog stick even resulted in blisters and burns to the hands, and Nintendo offered protective gloves to prevent injuries.

Rumble Pak

The original Rumble Pak, designed for the Nintendo 64 controller, was released in April 1997 to coincide with the release of Star Fox 64 and required two AAA batteries. Its specific use was to provide haptic feedback during gameplay; an effort to make the gaming experience more engaging. It was designed to be inserted into the controller's memory cartridge slot, which prevented the use of the Controller Pak. This usually had little impact, as Nintendo 64 games were cartridge based and had the ability to store saved data in the cartridge itself. This was also true because the insertion of a controller Pak was prompted at every point of save in case the before said Pak was not already in place.

Source: Wikipedia, "Nintendo 64 controller", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84732.name: Kariba
84732.description:
All animals are thirsty after an adventurous day in the Savannah. They all come to the drinking grounds. Every animal wants to be the first to drink, but watch out!!! The elephant scares the lion, the lion scares the zebra and the zebra scares the antelope. Anything can happen. The antelope might even scare the elephant. The player who scares away the most animals is the winner.

Place the board in the middle of the table. Shuffle the cards and deal 5 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards face down into the holder in the center of the board. The oldest player begins, so everyone can benefit from his wisdom. Then the round start with a clockwise direction. During a round a player goes through the following steps: Play one or more cards of the same animal. Place the cards in the corresponding position (1-9) around the lake. Just make sure it is clear to see how many cards there are. If you have 1 or more playing cards of the same animal and more than three cards, then the animal left of the weaker animal (lower number) chases it. This player wins all the cards from the weaker animal, even if the number of cards higher than the driven away animal. If you drove an animal away, pick up all of the playing cards off the board and put them face down in front of you. Each card is worth 1 point, and the winner is the one with the most points.

84733.name: GameStop Dance Pad
84733.description:
User Summary

A third party controller produced by GameStop for the Dance Dance Revolution series of games.

84734.name: Monstrous Mayhem
84734.description:
From the back cover:

The new class strikes again!

After awhile, goblins cease to be frightening, gold loses its luster, and underground dungeons, ruined cities and ancient temples cease to be an attraction. Your players want new sights, new adventures, and new threats to challenge their skill, might, and wits.

Fear not! For those Referees who need to give their game that spark of something new, we present MONSTROUS MAYHEM, the first source-book for Spellcraft & Swordplay! Within these pages you will find a new Elite Path, rules for hedge magic and legerdemain, mass combat, underwater adventures, a host of new monsters and more!

Designed for the Deluxe Edition of Spellcraft & Swordplay, but completely compatible with the original or revised editions, MONSTROUS MAYHEM will become an invaluable resource for players and Referees alike!

84736.name: Shaman King: Power of Spirit
84736.description:
User Summary

This game features the characters of the popular manga series, Shaman King as they fight for the chance to be the Shaman King, a shaman able to do whatever he likes. They each have their own reasons for doing so whether these reasons be benevolent or malicious.

The player takes control of Yoh, moving him around on a simulated board at first, then fighting his enemies in an arcade style fighter. This is one of the only games that molds these two game genres in such a way.

84738.name: Battle Chess 4000
84738.description:
Battle Chess 4000 takes the same mechanics from the original Battle Chess, but uses a humorous science fiction theme with cartoony animation. Pawns are dumb, worm-like creatures; with Rooks being transforming robots.

The battle sequences of the pieces are usually humorous in nature and involve pop-culture references (such as lightsabers and the monolith from Space Odyssey).

Source: User Summary

84739.name: OutRun 2019
84739.description:
Out Run 2019 (アウトラン 2019) is a Sega Mega Drive/Genesis-only pseudo-sequel to Out Run that takes place in the future. The object is to race against time in a rocket-powered car across four different stages around the world. Like the original Out Run, there is a fork in the road before each checkpoint; however, there can also be forks within a single route.

The maximum speed of the car as indicated on the game is 341 km/h (211.89 mph) on the Japanese version, 682 km/h (423.77 mph) on the European version and 682 mph (1097.57 km/h) on the USA version.

Source: Wikipedia, "Outrun 2019", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84742.name: Mystery Quest
84742.description:
Mystery Quest is a side-scrolling platform action game originally developed by Carry Lab, and published in Japan as Hao Kun no Fushigina Tabi (Hao Kun no Fushigina Tabi - literally Little Hao's Mysterious Journey) for the Famicom Disk System by Square in 1987. It was later localized for the American market and published for the NES by Taxan in 1989. While localizing the game, Taxan decided to make the game shorter and generally easier by eliminating over a third of the content. While Mystery Quest ends after only four castles, Hao Kun no Fushigina Tabi continues with a third world and two additional castles.

Source: The Game Website.

84743.name: Life of Christ: Bible Journeys No. 2
84743.description:
Follow the life of Christ from Bethlehem to Calvary. Players move along a path that follows the events of the life of Christ and answer questions on cards that are drawn. First player to the end wins.

User Summary

84744.name: Savage World of Slaine
84744.description:
From the introduction:
This setting is based on the 2000AD comic of Slaine as well as Mongoose Publishing’s RPG setting for the d20 system. It started off as a small add-on for the Savage Mythic Ireland setting by John Briquelet, a truly great setting for Savage Worlds, but soon evolved into a setting of its own although I've stolen bits and pieces.

84745.description:
This is a game for 2 players. You need 1 set of Nestortiles.

Each player chooses 5 colours and takes the corresponding tiles.
One player begins by placing a tile valued 1 on to the table. Then the players continue alternately.

On his turn a player puts 1 to 3 (dependent on the move type) tiles onto the table. There are 6 possibilities to extend the building:

(Floor tiles are tiles directly on the table, wall tiles are vertical tiles and top tiles are horizontal tiles not touching the table)


Floor - A tile directly on the table touching at least one other tile.
Corner Wall - Two adjacent vertical tiles with an inbetween angle of 90°, both touching a floor tile.
Single Wall - A vertical tile touching at least one other wall tile. It also has to touch a floor or top tile.
Tunnel - The top tile has to touch exactly one wall tile, and may additionally touch one or more top tiles. On the opposite side of the touching wall side another wall is placed.
Single Top - A top tile touching at least 2 wall tiles.
Corner Top - A top tile touching at least 2 other top tiles but no wall tile. On every side not touching another top tile a wall tile is added.


There are some additional restrictions for the moves:

The players have to use the tiles colour by colour. Only if the first used colour is completely placed on the table, the next colour may be used. So if there is only one tile remaining in a colour the player can only place one tile in his next turn. The colour by colour rule is meant to be for the tiles of one player. Example: Player A starts with a yellow tile. Player B continues with two green tiles. Now player A has to continue with yellow until all yellow is used. Only then player A may choose his next colour. (Same for player B with green)

Each placed tile has to touch at least one tile with the same or a smaller value. The dots of the top tiles always must be on the top side. So it is not possible to have a top directly above a floor.

A player wins if he places all 30 tiles on the table.
A player loses if he has no legal move (Beware of tiles with small value).
84745.name: Temple

84746.name: Nagashino Shitaragahara
84746.description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #7.

Small card-driven game covering a famous battle during Sengoku era.
In 1575, Katsuyori Takeda ((武田 勝頼) invaded Mikawa controlled by Ieyasu Tokugawa (徳川 家康). Nobunaga Oda decided to reinforce Tokugawa. He fought Takeda's traditional horsemen with innovative tactics and arquebusiers.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Nagashino

Takeda must conquer the Nagashino castle before the game end and Tokugawa must prevent him to succeed.

Components:

1 map
80 counters
4 pages rulebook
30 cards
2 dice

84747.name: Mummy: Tomb of the Pharaoh
84747.description:
User summary:

Mummy: Tomb of the Pharaoh is an adventure game set in Egypt. You play the role of investigator Michael Cameron hired by the National Mining Company. The miners refuse to work and your task is to investigate their claims and suspicions that the mine is cursed by a mummy which has reawakened.

Navigate through amazing Egyptian scenery, outsmart antagonists, and solve over 50 exciting puzzles by means of point and click interface where you get the chance to pick up and manipulate items.

84748.name: Guided Lands
84748.description:
Guided Lands - Tabletop battles for all fantasy miniatures

Guided Lands is a new tabletop game for two players, ages 14 and up. The game has an universal approach to tabletop gaming, where almost all fantasy miniatures with a scale around 28mm can be fielded in battle. Players take on the role of two mighty warlords, who muster their troops to claim the throne and be crowned king of the Guided Lands. Doing so players will use a unique step-by-step approach to create different races and equip their soldiers with weapons, armor and special abilities, thus making nearly all of your fantasy miniatures you have lying around somewhere ready to be used as heroes or units in Guided Lands. The scale ranges from small skirmishes to epic battles including monsters, magic and powerful artillery. An easy and streamlined ruleset as well as a card-driven initiative system keeps gameplay fast, while also engaging for seasoned tabletop generals. So dust of your old miniatures and start playing!

Guided Lands is the first game of the new publisher Smiling Monster Games and will be released in a limited first edition of 500 copies at Essen Spiel 2010 in German language (Hall 6, booth 6-808), estimated price € 20 (softcover book).

More information at www.smiling-monster.de

84749.name: Asterix and the Secret Mission
84749.description:
User summary:

A side scrolling action game based on the French comic book series Asterix. The village druid Getafix is in trouble. He is out of his magic potion and is in need of ingredients. You are sent on a secret mission to locate the desperately needed herbs so he can brew his potion again.

There are six levels in the game and you get to choose either Asterix or Obelix at the beginning of each. Depending on the character used, you get to play some entirely different segments. Run, jump, slide down hills and punch your way through Roman defences in an attempt to complete your quest.

84750.description:
This is the oldest book in Japan for history related in Japan.
It is 30 volumes and is the fantasy story. The player are the editors for Nihon syoki.
They collect the category cards, and make the book, put the tile on the board corresponded the space. The spaces are connected by lines to some space.
These are the story's web.
The game is 6 rounds. The player has the 1 action on 3 each areas per 1 round. Get the category card, bonus card, make the book, change the order and so on.

45 Category card
3 Library card
12 Offering card
24 Point card
18 Bonus card
40 Player tile(10 per player)
1 Round Maker
4 Board(They can make any patterns)
1 Round / Action Board
1 Rule
84750.name: Nihonsyoki

84751.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 4- Dec 1988)
rpgissue: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine
84751.description:
Contents:

•News
•William Gibson interview by Paul Broughton
•Paint Shop special
•Reviews - City of the Invincible Overlord, Dark Future, Halls of the Eleven King, Forgotten Realms City System, Kviser Rocks, Megatraveller, Lancelot, Tribes of Crane
•PBM Update by Wayne
•Livingstone and Jackson, I presume
•Battles of Cetze - Exclusive Lone Wolf Roleplaying Adventure by Joe Dever
•'Zine Scene
•Incomplete Guide to roleplayers by John Sutherland & Nigel Gross
•Dawn of a Legend - A short Story by David Gemmell
•War in Middle Earth
•Rock Star's Fantasy Future
•Fantasy Battle
•Trouble at Mill - Live Roleplaying
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Critical Hits with David Langford

84752.name: Rocky Rodent
84752.description:
User Summary

Rocky Rodent, developed and published by Irem in 1993 is game for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. In the game the player takes control of Rocky Rodent on a mission to save the daughter of a restaurant owner. The daughter has been kidnapped by a local mob boss, Don Garcia. If Rocky succeeds his reward will be an all-you-can-eat meal at the restaurant.

Rocky Rodent is a fairly standard 2D platform game. The player can find four different upgrades in the form of hairstyles that allow new attacks or moves. The game features 6 stages.

84753.name: Run Saber
84753.description:
From the back of the box:

SWORDS OF FURY

The year is 2998 and Earth is hopelessly polluted. Mankind's last chance for a clean planet rests in the hands of Dr. Bruford's plan to use radiation to trigger a change. Only, something goes horribly wrong! Dr. Bruford is mutated and begins an evil quest for world domination!

Enter the Run Sabers. Cybernetically advanced humans with the raw power to level cities! As Allen, use the Thunder Sword to create concussive waves of energy! As Sheena, wield the Ice Sword to slam a blizzard at the mad doctor's forces. Team up for non-stop action that is guaranteed to put your skills to the ultimate test in this futuristic adventure saga!


Special Attack Weapons blast enemies right off the screen!
Multiple offensive capabilities transform the heroes into unstoppable super soldiers!
Join in the fun with a friend with the 1 or 2-Player simultaneous action modes!

84755.name: Savage U.N.I.T.
84755.description:
User Summary: Adaptation of material from the Dr. Who universe to the Savage Worlds! rpg.

From the introduction:
All players start as members of the United Nations Intelligence Taskforce with all the rights and responsibilities that entail from working for the U.N. Player characters are not restricted to military men (or women) as U.N.I.T. needs all sorts to help it run smoothly and efficiently. PCs can also be civilians who are somehow officially ‘attached’ to U.N.I.T. These might be; scientific advisors, government liaisons, undercover operatives, officials, or even reporters. Military player characters are assumed to be Officers or N.C.O.s.

84756.name: Savage Traveller
84756.description:
From the introduction:
Savage Traveller is an attempt to port what is great about classic Traveller to the Savage Worlds system. In keeping with the simple Fast, Furious, Fun rule system, no new skill has been added other than specific useful Knowledge skills. A few new edges have been created to provide for some Traveller specific feel.

84757.name: Savage Star Wars
84757.description: User Summary: One of a number of web-published conversions of Star Wars to the Savage Worlds! rpg system. This conversion splits even between discussion of Force Powers and Starships & Equipment.

84758.name: Savage TORG
84758.description:
From the introduction:
Let me say this first: Adapting Torg to Savage Worlds is like butchering a sacred cow. I love Torg. No game in the history of gaming has given me more hours of fun or more fond memories than Torg. So I put forth the following rules for adapting Torg to Savage Worlds play with some trepidation. I still would like to see Torg return to the industry, but every year that passes leaves it deeper in the grave, and my hope dwindles.

84759.name: ¿Conoces España?
84759.description:
From the instructions booklet cover:

Educational game. Geography, History, folklore, industry and commerce of Spain.

Components: (User Summary):

-72 round pieces
-Map in six sections of 34x16cm each
-Rules booklet

Goal:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the pieces corresponding to each location.

Game mechanics:

Players must fill the spaces in the map with the counters pulled out randomly from any opaque container after identyfing the correct location for each.
There are three levels of difficulty (low, medium, high).



Juego instructivo. Geografia, Historia, costumbres, industria y comercio de España.

Componentes:

-72 fichas circulares de cartón
-Mapa en seis secciones rectangulares de 34x16cm cada una.
-Instrucciones

Objetivo:

Los jugadores deben rellenar el mapa con las fichas correspondientes a cada localización.

Mecánica de juego:

Los jugadores van extrayendo las fichas de cualquier recipiente opaco y tras identificar el lugar al que pertenecen las van colocando en el mapa.
Existen tres niveles de dificultad (elemental, medio, superior).

84760.name: Feeding Frenzy
84760.description:
User Summary:

"Feeding Frenzy" presents the player with a single screen of ocean. As a fish, the player must eat bigger & bigger fish to grow & survive in the ocean. The more you eat, the bigger you get.

84761.name: Nordmark
84761.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ravaged by civil war and the subsequent war brought on by the exiled young heir returning to claim his throne, Nordmark has suffered its share of hardship. On the surface the kingdom appears to be on the slow road to rebuilding, but there are those who would see Nordmark ruled by others or crushed altogether.

This supplement explores Nordmark's society, expands the cult of Rigr, presents two new Edges, and details an optional setting rule for heroic deaths. GMs will find six major locales, two new cults, three NPC archetypes, and a powerful servant of the gods.

84762.name: Winter Sports 2009: The Next Challenge
84762.description:
From the back of the box:

Your ultimate Winter Sports Cahllenge!
Go for the golg in 10 different thrilling sports - with friends, or all by yourself.

Features
18 disciplines of the 10 most popular winter sports, now also including biathlon and snowboarding.
Gripping multiplayer modes for up to 4 players.
Campaign and career mode full of variety for long-lasting gaming fun.

84763.name: Keeper's Screen
84763.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For the 6th Edition Call of Cthulhu Rules.

Here is a 3-panel Keeper’s Screen mounted on thick hard-cover stock that folds out to 33" wide x 8.5" tall. One side of this heavy-duty screen features a panoramic view of investigators out in the field, exploring strange and enormous sculptures. The other side includes the essential tables, states of sanity, order of play, and other rules references to speed game play and keep secret from the players the diabolical machinations of the keeper.

This pack also includes a 22 x 34" poster by the mad french artists Christian Grussi and El Théo, postulating relationships between the deities and minions of the Cthulhu Mythos.

84764.name: Le Loto Des Saveurs
84764.description:
A follow-up to Le Loto Des Odeurs, Le Loto Des Saveurs attempts to teach children about flavours.

The game contains 30 jars with tiny candies, and 30 cards with images of the different flavours. Each turn, one jar is opened and each player gets a candy. They now try to identify the flavour as quickly as possible. A player that wants to make a guess grabs the corresponding card, after which his guess is verified by the game master.

The game is won by the player who has guessed the most flavours correctly at the end of the game.

84765.name: Savage Thunderbirds
84765.description:
From the introduction:
Thunderbirds is a ground breaking tv show produced in Britain in the mid 1960s by Gerry and Sylvia Anderson. The show used Anderson’s trademark puppetry style, dubbed "Supermarionation" and is renowned for it’s relentless action, remarkable visuals and large explosions. Not to mention the cool vehicles. The show centres on International Rescue, an organisation founded by ex- astronaut Jeff Tracy, dedicated to using high-tech equipment to provide aid to those in need around the world.

Savage Thunderbirds came about as a dare. In a break in our regular gaming schedule, I suggested to the group that I could use Savage Worlds to create an adventure in any setting they cared to mention. I got off lightly,they chose Thunderbirds and this document is the result. It is by no means a complete sourcebook for this wonderful show but it allowed me to run some fun sessions and hopefully may encourage you to do the same, or at the very least check out this great show if you’ve not seen it before.

84766.name: The Jetsons: Cogswell's Caper!
84766.description:
User Summary

The Jetsons: Cogswell's Caper! is a game for the Nintendo Entertainment System from 1992. The game is based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon `The Jetsons,' and the player plays as George Jetson. Can George save planet M38 from Cogswell's mining factory?

84767.name: Savage Thundarr!
84767.description:
User Summary: Conversion of the Thundarr the Barbarian TV show to Savage Worlds.

From the introduction:
Where were you in 1980? I was sitting in front of my TV on a Saturday Morning watching what would soon inflame my malleable little pea brain- Thundarr the Barbarian!

I loved it!

It had all the trappings of Science Fiction and Fantasy. Plus I had just discovered AD&D (Yes! The original 1st ed. books! God I’m getting old...) a year before and I was starting to click the pieces together...

"Hmmm, I have a game that I love and a show I love." Years pass.

Thoughts swirl as I find Gamma World, Traveller, etc. some time later. What was it? An old show that this reminds me of...Hmmm...

84768.name: Tales from the Glittering Void Players Guide
84768.description:
Subtitle: A savage tribute to Spelljammer

User Summary: A conversion of the Spelljammer setting to the Savage Worlds rules. As well this includes description of a new realm, the Glittering Void. Material includes new character creation rules, spaceships, and arcane backgrounds.

84769.name: The Diplomat's and Explorer's Sourcebook
84769.description:
Publisher Blurb:
In the Ephemeris core rulebook, we introduced you to the Diplomat and the Explorer...now see what else you can do with the Diplomat and the Explorer. The Diplomat's and Explorer's Sorucebook features several new sub-classes for both classes, and it also features new skills, weapons, armor, and goods that are designed to help round out the Diplomat and Explorer classes.

84770.name: Zomboree
84770.description:
Zomboree is a large group social card game (6 - 16 people) where players take on the roles of various survivors in a town under seige by zombies. Each turn is affected by an event card drawn for that day. Each turn is divided into two phases: Day and Night. A 90 second timer is provided with the game to provide a fair length for both phases.

During setup, survivor cards will be handed out. One of the survivors will be Patient Zero and become a zombie at the end of the first day. Each survivor starts with one item. After everyone has an item, the group elects their leader. Since no one knows anyone else's role, it is possible to elect Patient Zero as the group's leader. Anytime the leader becomes a zombie, the survivors must elect a new leader before beginning the day phase.

During the day the elected leader of the survivors draws resource cards and the survivors discuss how to divide them up. Some of the Survivors, however, are infected and will eventually join the Zombies attacking the Survivors. At the end of each day, players check their character cards to see if they have become a zombie.

During the night, the players who have become zombies play attack cards of various types against the remaining survivors. The survivors must work together to defend themselves using the resources they found during the day to resist and shunt off zombie attacks in order to survive. Those who cannot stop or deflect a zombie attack, become zombies who will get a zombie attack card the next night.

The game's scenario runs for one week's time, from Sunday to Saturday. Each turn an event card shapes both the day and night phases. Each day the survivors use their drawn resources to make a plan for resisting the zombies. Each night the zombies attack the survivors and try to wipe them out. The game ends after the night phase on Saturday when those still alive win by surviving the zombie apocalypse, or else when all survivors are dead (or undead, as it were).

boardgamehonor: 2011 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2011 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
84772.description:
From the publisher:

In *SUN, SEA & SAND* each player starts a resort on a tourist island. At the start you only have a plot of land. From there, you can build chalets to lodge tourists, attractions to persuade them to stay longer, or signs to help tourists find your resort.

You can pick up new tourists at the harbour, or work to book potential tourists in advance. Backpackers you can't pick up or book, but with signage you improve your chances that they find your place.

You only have 5 family members to do all the work and each activity costs TIME for one family member, so manage your money and time wisely! It's all in your hands (no luck involved).
84772.name: Sun, Sea & Sand

84773.name: SuperMark som købmand
84773.description:
Finally a card game about shopping, with pedagogic opportunities for dialogue, as well as super fun action with the sneaky SuperMark action cards. In this fun SuperMark game you will have to go shopping for your family. Each participant draws a shopping list, but do not think you'll be a certain winner, because as soon as you are closing in on the goods on your shopping list, an opponent can play the action card "switch shopping list", and then you will have to find the goods on that list.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each one with its own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

84774.name: SuperMark som postbud
84774.description:
Card games don't come better than this. You'll each draw a post card and with the help of a few questions, observations and memory, you will have to try to give the post card to the right person.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each with their own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

84775.name: SuperMark som superhelt
84775.description:
SuperMark is a sympathetic and easy beginner game. The game where good deeds are rewarded. The optimal beginner card game, where the child has at most three cards on their hand at all times. In this fun card game you'll have to avert an accident. Play a accident card on the table, for example a boy who's about to jump in a swimming pool without water, and then find the hero card in which SuperMark pours water into the pool. The game consists of 40 super nice cards - with fun hero deeds.

The SuperMark card games come in five different variations, each with their own theme. The games are especially good for pre-school children, as they will learn how to, purely motorically, hold the cards, and they get practice in colours, combinations, numbers and relations.

84776.name: Summy
84776.description:
Similar to placing letters in Scrabble, teams take alternate turns placing 1-8 tiles to build a valid sum in horizontal or vertical direction. In each sum you must use at least 1 block which is already on table.

For each digit in a sum you get its value as victory points. So you try to use high numbers which are already placed. You can place high numbers from your own blocks too, but your opponents can profit when you place them easily available and combinable with other placed blocks. You should also try to hold good combinations of digits and operators for later turns.

While it requires calculating, it is more a puzzle game than a math game. You mainly search for possibilities by using deduction logic instead of calculating (which is induction logic).

84778.description:
From the publisher/author:

FLASH! FLASH! FLASH! Photograph the 10 animals in the safari park. Follow the animals to take good photos. However, it is not easy since the animals don't stand still! Try to predict where they are going in order to get in position for the shot!

GAME RULES SUMMARY:

In your turn, you move in one direction along a straight line of connected spaces. You can only move through open land, not through trees or water.

After all players have their turn, each animal moves 1 step to the land space in front of it.
If you are in a space alongside or in front of an animal, you take a photo of that animal (nobody wants to see a picture of an animal's behind!).

The winner is the first player to photograph all 10 animals.

Online Play


Jijbent.nl (turnbased, Dutch)
YourTurnMyTurn.com (turnbased, English)
84778.name: Tricky Safari

84780.name: Savage Stargate
84780.description:
From the introduction:
Iʼve always been a fan of Stargate SG-1 and later, the other Stargate series. When I got into role-playing games, I was excited to find out that there was a Stargate SG-1 roleplaying game and wanted to give it a try. When I borrowed a copy from a friend, I was initially impressed by the faithfulness to the series. But that excitement fell away when I discovered the dizzying number of combat options. Even worse, the gear section was a mess. I spent a good five minutes trying to find a P-90 and scratched my head when I found that I could take an MMORPG with me to a planet. By and large, I realized that this system wasnʼt for me.

I believe that Savage Worlds is a system that could easily capture the exciting feel of the shows, especially during the more action-packed episodes. Iʼve created a conversion that Iʼve used with my role-playing group at college and theyʼve loved it, so Iʼd like to share it with the world. Itʼs my goal to create a conversion that is useful and accurately captures the feel of the shows. I encourage any feedback to help this to happen.

84781.name: Savage Star Wars
84781.description:
From the introduction:
I’m a Star Wars fan. Yes, in spite of the prequels. It’s sad that we Star Wars fanboys have to put that qualifier in these days, but such is the times we live in. As a Star Wars fan, I’ve been playing the Star Wars games long before the prequels, which means long before Wizards of the Coast got their hands on Star Wars, and long before even Timothy Zahn wrote the first novels that gave the world a picture of what was going on with Luke, Leia, Han and Chewie after Return of the Jedi. That’s right; I was playing the d6 West End Games version of Star Wars.

When I first played Savage Worlds a year or so back, I thought this would make an excellent rules system for Star Wars, and lo and behold I found I wasn’t the only one who thought so. On the Savage Worlds Fan Conversion web page I already saw three good attempts to take a crack at it. Victor Lacroix’s own Star Wars 1.2.1 conversion SAVAGE! Star Wars from the d20 Saga Edition was, by far, the best one of the bunch.

In all due respect to Mr. Lacroix and the people who helped him make that work, I thought that approaching Star Wars by converting the Saga Edition’s version of things to Savage Worlds was the wrong way to go about it. Rather, the best way to making a Savage Worlds Star Wars game was to take what you see from all six movies and other materials as you see them, instead of what others interpret them to be.

With that in mind I set about to make my own Savage Worlds Star Wars conversion primarily because I was utterly tired of Saga Edition and d20 in general. When you’ve played Savage Worlds, you look at d20 with a whole new perspective, wondering why they bothered to make things more complicated than it needed to be. I found myself ignoring or forgetting most of the rules for d20 because they got in the way of the game play itself.

84782.name: Savage Dawn
84782.description:
Subtitle: A SAVAGE edition of EARTHDAWN

From the introduction:
Welcome to Savage Dawn!
This little document is all you need to play Earthdawn with Savage Worlds rules. On the following pages you’ll find rules for the races, for the various disciplines, how magic works without Power Points and so on and so forth. This is a work in progress and while pretty much all the basics are covered, the feedback from playtests may dramatically alter the contents of this file.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2012 Mensa Select Winner
84783.description:
Coerceo is a strategic board game that is played between two players. The objective of the game is to win from your opponent by enclosing the opponents pieces and thus removing them from the board. Coerceo has only a few basic game rules that can be mastered in just a couple of minutes.

The Coerceo board consists of 19 board tiles, each tile having 6 sides (hexagonal shape). A tile has 6 alternating black and white triangles marked on them. The 19 board tiles placed against each other make up the Coerceo modular game board. Each player starts with 18 identical game pieces which represent them on the board. Each game piece is a tetrahedron (i.e. shaped like a three sided ‘pyramid’). All game pieces have the same playing capabilities, which are moving and enclosing pieces from the opponent.

The Coerceo board gets smaller during the game when tiles are taken away from the board. This means that the opponent is never far away.
84783.name: Coerceo

84784.name: Roadwar 2000
84784.description:
Back of the Box:

"When Highways Become Battlefields....

In the year 2000, bacteriological warfare has ripped apart the very fabric of American civilization. Cities have turned into gangland prices; the highways, into battlefields."

Turn based strategy game from SSI taking their (at the time) well established tactical and strategic war gaming formulas into the genre of Mad Max. Players lead a road gang around a map of the United States searching for scientists who can bring an end to the plague attack. Players loot cities and towns for supplies and vehicles, search for new gang members and helpful specialists, and fight other armed gangs.

Game play took place on a map of the United States. Turns were usually in one or two hour blocks of time in an eight to ten hour day, but bad weather would cause time to pass more quickly. No travel or road combat took place at night, but night brought the threat of mutant attack.

When road combat occurred, the game switched to a tactical combat mode where the player moved around vehicles on a map of the terrain (highway, town, countryside, etc.) with men ("Crew") acting more or less as both hit points and gun emplacements. Cars could be destroyed by killing all of the enemy crew, by ramming and destroying them with larger and/or better reinforced vehicles, or they could be made to crash by blasting out the tires. Your topside crew could also board enemy vehicles and commandeer them, which was very difficult to pull off.

Enemies came in three flavors: groups on foot encountered in cities, including the folks who controlled the city, road gangs like the players' own, and the plague infected mutants who roamed the night. Enemy road gangs usually had colorful names ("Hot Rod Lincolns," "Mother Truckers" etc). Foot groups included mercenaries, street gangs, the Mob, Invaders (the game assumes a germ warfare attack was followed by a ground invasion), Satanists, cannibals, the homeless, and others.

When scouting out foot groups, players could also encounter specialists who would offer to join the gang. The specialists could be encountered in different places depending on their specialty. Doctors could be found at clinics or hospitals, or special locations like the Mayo Clinic. They reduced casualties during combat and reduced the risk of plague infection. Politicians could be encountered in Washington DC or among the homeless; they improved other groups attitudes towards you and made scouting less dangerous. Drill Instructors reduced combat losses, made your gang members better at combat, and sped the rate at which your men improved; they could be found at military bases or special locations like Colorado Springs.

Roadwar 2000 was a rather unforgiving game, befitting the genre. The game randomly resets itself whenever a new session begins, so nuclear blast sites and ownership of cities is always different (New York City could be occupied by Invaders one session, and owned by no one in the next one) and sometimes cruel. Players can expect to be wiped out many times before falling into a groove. Bad luck during starting placement could kill a players' gang very quickly - for example, starting off in a town next to a nuclear blast site (e.g. - starting in Baltimore when Washington DC has been destroyed) almost guaranteed being killed at night by mutants. Nevertheless, it was addicting.

By Jeff Johnson

84785.name: Piro
84785.description:
This card game is played mainly in Afganistan and Iran. It was mentioned in an article in GAMES magazine, sometime in the 2000s. It is similar to, but differs a fair bit (scoring and key cards), from the card game known as Casino and another called "Bazra".

The game uses a standard 52-card deck, without jokers. After an initial deal of five cards to each person (2-player only), two cards are turned up in the middle of the table. After playing one card at a time from the hand, another 5 cards are dealt to the players once their current hand is empty. Thus, each game segment lasts 5 rounds (10 cards per round + the initial 2 card outlay).

Points (always 5 per game segment) are given at the end of the deck for the following:
Most cards = 2
Most clubs = 1
2 of clubs = 1
10 of diamonds = 1

See the A new 2-player card game (for most of you) for a visual explanation of rules and scoring basics.

84786.name: Savage Legend of the Five Rings
84786.description:
From the introduction:
Translated by John W. Thompson...from Alderac Entertainment’s Legend of the Five Rings RPG and Great White Games Savage World RPG as a work of fan support and intending no challenge to the rights and ownership of any and all involved. v1.0 translates the L5R 1.0 main book material to Savage Worlds game mechanics. This is by no means official and has not as of 2/4/04 been play tested so use at your own descression. I plan to add info from the clan books and such in the future as my time and interest permit. Enjoy. V1.1 adds material from Way of the Crab.

84787.name: Roadwar Europa
84787.description:
From the back of the box:

"Not Your Average Tour of Europe.

In the 21st century, Europe suffers the same bio-war that devastated America, a holocaust that established the deadly scenario for SSI's exciting ROADWAR 2000.

Now this sequel, ROADWAR EUROPA, creates a post-doomsday Europe held hostage by maniacal terrorists. They have already destroyed one city with a dirty nuclear device and threaten to detonate five more across the continent."

This was a sequel to Roadwar 2000. Gameplay was similar; players managed a road gang traveling across a map of Europe, Russia and the Near East left wasteland by biological warfare. Suddenly jihad sweeps out of the Middle East threatening the delicate recovery. The player must locate and defuse five dirty nuclear bombs, contact the underground forces opposing the jihadists, and then locate and destroy the terrorist base. Road combat took place on a tactical map allowing the player to maneuver modified vehicles against each other, and gang members ("Crew") acting as hit points.

Players had to loot familiar European cities to keep in supply while encountering Terrorist regulars and sympathizers, Soldiers (presumably surviving pockets of NATO troops), police forces, cannibals, hoodlums, the homeless, and others.

By Jeff Johnson

84788.name: Bauer sucht Frau: Das Kartenspiel
84788.description:
Party game based on a German TV show. The game consists of cards with sentence starts and four possible endings. Each player also has a set of four guessing cards (A-D, one for each answer) and some heart chips. The sentences deal mostly with men/women stereotypes.
In each round, a player reads the sentence and the four endings, then each player chooses an answer option. Then pairs are assigned and the two players try to guess what answer the other player chose. The first successful pair exchanges heart chips. If only one player guessed correctly, he/she gets a single point. After 12 rounds, heart chips are counted, with multiple chips in the same color counting less than a diversity of colors. Bonus points are added and the player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

84789.name: Justifiers Savaged Edition
84789.description:
From the introduction:
You will need a copy of the Savage Worlds core book Savage Worlds (Revised Second Edition) and the Justifiers main rulebook Justifiers (2nd Edition) to fully use this document. All page references relate to the Revised edition of Savage Worlds. Just imagine the Blade Runner world where Replicants are made by Dr Moreau... A great setting with some very cool ideas but a set of rules which is, well...a bit dated. Another game that was just begging to become a Savage World setting !

84790.name: Savage Worlds Fantasy
84790.description:
User Summary:

A web-published conversion which takes the Lejendary setting and coverts it to Savage Worlds mechanics. Extensive character creation, gear, weapons, arcane backgrounds, and bestiary are provided.

84791.name: Asterix
84791.description:
User summary

Asterix is a side scrolling action game based on the French comic book series Asterix.

Choose to play as Asterix or Obelix, run, jump, avoid traps and punch your way through hordes of Romans in an effort to rescue the village druid Getafix who has been kidnapped.

84792.name: Savage Worlds Leverage
84792.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to my conversion of Leverage for Savage Worlds. Allow me to make a few comments before we begin.

I am assuming that you already know how to play Savage Worlds and are familiar with the core rules. I won’t explain any of that stuff as I go along, unless I feel something needs clarification or modification for the purposes of this conversion.

I am also assuming that you are familiar with the television show on which this conversion is based. If you’re not a fan of Leverage, then why are you even reading this? I swear, I just don’t understand you sometimes...More seriously, it’s important that you are fairly familiar with the show and especially the main characters (Nathan, Sophie, Hardison, Eliot, and Parker), so that you can make sense of various comments and examples.

84793.name: Battle-Girl
84793.description:
Battle Girl is an arcade-style top-down shooter computer game for Mac OS and Windows, released by Ultra/United in September 1997. Its allure is its high-pace action, vector graphics and techno music.

You play the role of Battle-Girl by piloting her Soyuz 1183-A BattleCraft and destroying programmers released by Terminus, weapon of Chaos. You must journey through countless programs and protect their function pods to defeat Terminus and save the Great Machine. Fortunately, you are armed with not only vast firepower, but also with a girlish wit and a violent disposition.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Girl", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84794.name: London Fogs
84794.description:
From the introduction:
Background: It is the spring of 1889 and London is beset by a plague of disappearances near the riverfront. Rumors of a "Demon of Fog: are being played up by the press and passed off by the police as wild rumors. Scotland Yard was unhappy that no sign of ransom, abduction for slavery, or bodies of victims had been found. None of the victims had anything in common other than being last seen in the riverfront area. Because of this atmosphere of fear, London is downright scary (-1 to Guts rolls). Beginning players can either be English natives or visitors from other nations in for their own personal reasons.

Setting: Originally designed as an introduction to Savage Worlds and the Space 1889 Victorian age science fiction adventuring, this adventure can be used without the Space 1889 background. Just ignore any references to travel to the other worlds of our solar system and play it as a Victorian Pulp setting. Players should be humans and the Arcane Backgrounds should be limited to Weird Science unless the GM says otherwise.

84795.name: Savage Worlds Mass Effect (Version 4.1)
rpgissuearticle: Eclipse Phase vs Mass Effect - Biotics
Eclipse Phase vs Mass Effect - Kinetic Barriers
84795.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to the latest version of my Mass Effect conversion for Savage Worlds. A few things before we get started:

The major change since the last version (v3.0) is the addition of a bestiary. I’ve also added a section on heavy weapons, changed how shields work a bit, modified some talents, and tweaked the racial edges and hindrances a bit. There are also a variety of smaller changes and corrections that I won’t enumerate here.
This is still primarily a conversion of the first video game; however, it does contain some things from the second game (e.g., a couple of PC races, a few talents / powers, some bad guys for the bestiary, etc.). Please don’t contact me to tell that certain things work differently in the second game than in the first- I know already, thank you.
This is in no way a complete point-by-point conversion of every little thing from the video games. I draw your attention to the following excerpt from the SWEX core rule book: "All too often conversions of other games try to account for every element- massive skill lists, minute details, and hundreds of powers. This isn’t Savage Worlds, and bringing in those elements is likely to burden the rules to the point where the game play is no longer fast, furious, or fun" (137). Indeed, FFF is my guiding principle. As such, you won’t find stats for every single different brand of pistol, or skills that match every single aspect of the (first) video game character skill system. I’ve also occasionally done things differently than the video games for gameplay balance or in order to make certain aspects of the Mass Effect universe cohere better with the SW rules (again, please don’t contact me to tell me that things work differently in the games than I have here- I know). Ultimately, I’m only interested in playing Savage Worlds with a Mass Effect flavor, not playing an exact replica of the video games in pen-and-paper form.
You won’t find much fluff here- mainly just crunch. I don’t spend a lot of time describing the Mass Effect universe, the races and cultures, the inhabitable worlds, the technology, or anything like that. I’m assuming that if you’re interested in this conversion, then you are already familiar with the video game, and don’t need me to tell you about it. If you are looking for a bit more information, there are various wiki- Google will help you find them.
I’ve made this for myself as GM. As such, I’ve designed it for my personal preferences. I understand that there may be a variety of different ways to convert Mass Effect, all equally legitimate, but I’ve stuck with creating a conversion that I want to run. If your preferences differ, just use from this what you like and change the rest.

84796.name: Savage Worlds Mass Effect (Version 1)
84796.description:
User Summary:
A web-published conversion of the Mass Effect video-game universe to the Savage Worlds system. Presents a graphic-heavy discussion of the Mass Effect setting, character creation and gear options as well as Biotic and Tech backgrounds.

84797.name: Muchachada Nui: el juego de mesa
84797.description:
This is a card game based on a Spanish TV show of "strange" humor and parodies for 3-4 players. You'll find many characters from this program and have some laughs. In the game of Muchachada Nui the players, in the paper of surrealistic television producers, pay the cache of important Celebrities to gain hearing points. The first program that arrives to the maximum level of hearing will be proclaimed as the winner. Just play the cards to get points as you use your Celebrities and cards to stop other players in this TV race.

From the publisher:

There is a hollow in the grill of programming of Spanish television. The managers are very worried and hopelessly looking for a new program. As young producer you must prepare your best TV program of varieties and you have a great list of personalities for it. Contract the surrealistic Celebrities, discover to the public the most incredible histories and create a spectacular Plate to captivate the spectators. Only the program with more success will finish within the programming!

But care, the Celebrities that you can contract not only attracts the hearing. All has special qualities: Samantha Fox and Sabrina Salerno attract masculine Celebrities of the program of an opponent, Bud Spencer can leave them out of action with a hand strike and you do not want to know what happens when Chuck Norris appears in action. Freddy Krueger has nightmares with Chuck Norris!

Also it adds to your program special sections like the Tertulianos, the Tontiploster, the Klamstein or the Consultation of Junior Rappel to call even more the attention of the spectators and decorates your Plate with diverse styles, to everyone more baroque, to have the perfect aspect. It is not a shame if they say: You, Baroque!

Will you have suitable assistants? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, the Tridente Catacroker. The tragedy is in the atmosphere! The VHS tape will gonna jump through the window!

Muchachada Nui is a card game for three or four players of thirteen years or more. You will be able to play a game of thirty to sixty minutes, but maybe you’ll get caught for some hours...


En español:

Hay un hueco en la parrilla de programación de televisión española. Los directivos están muy preocupados y buscan un nuevo programa desesperadamente. Como joven productor debes preparar tu mejor programa televisivo de variedades y para ello cuentas con un gran elenco de personalidades. Contrata a las más rutilantes Celebrities, descubre al público las historias más increíbles y crea un espectacular Plató para cautivar a la audiencia. ¡Sólo el programa con más éxito acabará dentro de la programación!

En el juego de Muchachada Nui los jugadores, en el papel de surrealistas productores de televisión, pagan el caché de importantes Celebrities para ganar puntos de audiencia. El primer programa que llegue al máximo nivel de audiencia será proclamado vencedor.

Pero cuidado, las Celebrities que puedes contratar no sólo atraen a la audiencia. Todas tienen cualidades especiales... Samantha Fox y Sabrina Salerno atraen a Celebrities masculinas del programa de un oponente, Bud Spencer puede dejarlas fuera de combate de una tollina y no quieras saber que ocurre cuando Chuck Norris aparece en acción. ¡Freddy Krueger tiene pesadillas con Chuck Norris!

Por si fuera poco, añade a tu programa secciones especiales como Los Tertulianos, Los Tontiploster, Los Klamstein o La Consulta del Joven Rappel para llamar más la atención de los espectadores y decora tu Plató con diversos estilos, a cada cual más barroco, para tener la envoltura perfecta. Que no te avergüence que te digan ¡Barroco tú!

¿Seguro que contarás con ayudantes adecuados? Marcial, El Bonico del to, Enjuto Mojamuto, Riken Sproken, El Tridente Catacroker... ¡La tragedia se masca en el ambiente! ¡La cinta VHS está a punto de saltar por la ventana!

Muchachada Nui: El juego de mesa es un juego que se juega con cartas para tres o cuatro jugadores de trece años o más. Podréis echar una partida de treinta a sesenta minutos, aunque luego os liáis y os pueden dar las tantas.

84798.name: California Games II
84798.description:
From the back of the package:

Push your courage and cool to their limits in four innovative action sports from California. Showcase your skills speeding around the scateboard track, body boarding on foaming breakers, hang gliding over the ocean and snowboarding down perilous slopes.

84799.name: Sheep
84799.description:
Sheep is a puzzle game developed by Mind's Eye Productions and published by Empire Interactive for Windows and PlayStation in 2000. The Mac version was ported by Similis and published by Feral Interactive. The Game Boy Advance version was ported by Capcom and published by Empire Interactive.

The game was released for download from the PlayStation Store for PlayStation 3 and PSP on 14 August 2008.

Sheep bears some resemblance to the video game Lemmings. The player can choose between 4 herders, the people Bo Peep and Adam Halfpint, and the dogs Motley and Shep. The player must then guide sheep of 4 types (Pastoral, Factoral, Longwool, and NeoGenetic), actually aliens from the planet Ovis Aries, through a series of obstacles to the finish line in the level.There are a series of different worlds, starting with Polygon Farm and on to others, such as Village Fete and Lost in Space. If you collect all the golden sheep trophies in a world, you get to play a bonus game, devised from some other, like Snake (in this version, you are riding a sheep, and have to collect the trapped sheep in bubbles). The obstacles between you and victory vary from world to world, including tractors, knights, archers and demonic chefs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sheep (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84800.name: The Asylum: Psychiatric Clinic for Abused Cuddly Toys
84800.description:
User Summary

In The Asylum: Psychiatric Clinic for Abused Cuddly Toys, you take on the role of the psychiatrist in a mental asylum. Your patients? Abused cuddly toys. Through various therapeutic methods, your goal is to help your patients confront their past traumatic experiences. But understanding and care is necessary for successful treatments, because choosing the wrong options could result in a relapse, psychotic episode, or worse.

The gameplay of The Asylum is simple and straightforward. You see each patient in the examination room. Select a treatment or diagnosis option from your clipboard. As you progress, different options will become available to you. After each selection, you will be treated to a short animated clip. And hopefully your Therapy Progress bar will grow!

Despite the cuddly toy theme, this game contains traumatic images and is not suitable for young children.

84801.name: C.O.R.E.
84801.description:
C.O.R.E. is a first-person shooter video game that was released in Europe on March 27, 2009 and in North America on August 11, 2009.

The story begins in the year 2028, when a massive meteor impacts California's Mojave Desert. Over the next two decades, an underground research facility is built to examine the extraterrestrial origins and the bizarre effects that the meteor is having on the natural environment and the people who come in contact with it. The game takes place twenty years after the meteor's arrival on earth, 2048, when all communications are lost with the C.O.R.E. facility. After completion of the game an epilogue is viewed that shows the main character heading straight to a moon. On it lies a giant hexagon.

The game includes local multiplayer through the use of either a single game cartridge or multiple cartridges.

Source: Wikipedia, "C.O.R.E. (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84803.name: Black Sigil: Blade of the Exiled
84803.description:
Bel Lenora is a world where people are born with magic at their command. Years ago, a single man walked the land with no magic in his veins. He brought death and tragedy in his wake and was banished by a brave General at a great cost. It has been fifteen years since his banishment and once again, a young man with no magic walks the land of Bel Lenora.

Join Kairu, a young knight, born with a cursed spirit...

Key Features:

* Vivid environments create a realistic yet imaginative landscape
* 40-50+ hours of game play with tons of side-quests
* Dark secrets and powerful plot twists create an original and intriguing story line
* Strategically customize your 3 person party from up to 8 unique characters
* 100+ different physical and magical skills/combos
* 100+ different weapons
* 200+ different pieces of armor

Source: The Publisher Website.

84804.name: Savage Mouse Guard
84804.description: User Summary: Conversion of the Mouse Guard comic and rpg to the Savage Worlds rpg system. Focuses on character creation and general background for the setting.

84805.name: Mutant Bikers of the Atomic Wasteland (Savage Worlds)
84805.description:
From the introduction:
Mutant Bikers of the Atomic Wastelands (MBAW) is an original work by James Boldry originally created for use with the FUDGE rules by Steffan O’Sullivan. This conversion is a derivative work that seeks to capture the feel of MBAW using the Savage Worlds rules. There is no detailed setting for this game--it is the epitome of the "beer & pretzels RPG".

84806.name: Oriental Adventures Toolkit
84806.description:
Subtitle:

A netbook for Savage Worlds covering Wuxia-style settings. presents primarily character creation options, weapons, and arcane powers.

84808.name: Savage Apocalypse
84808.description:
Sub-title: A Savage Worlds Post-Apocalyptic Toolkit

From the introduction:
Out of all RPG settings, I have always loved post-apocalyptic (PA) settings, but I could not find a set of RPG rules I was happy with. At the beginning of 2007, I finally found Savage Worlds (SW). Therefore, it’s a privilege to combine Savage Worlds with a post-apocalypse setting in this toolkit. Now I have a great RPG setting and a great system to run it with. This document attempts to create a post-apocalyptic toolkit for Savage Worlds Explorers Edition (SWEX) and also extends/uses the Science Fiction World Builder Toolkit and Science Fiction Gear Toolkit. These documents are needed to utilize this toolkit.

Note that when referring to SWEX and the SW Toolkits, my references may lack in some details. This is intentional. My goal is to promote and extend these works, not replace them or cause a loss of revenue. Therefore, this document will refer the reader to the original documents for any further details. If flipping between a few sources becomes frustrating, then I ask your forbearance.

I exercised the liberty of enhancing or changing some SWEX rules to suit my campaign and ideas. Since I consider this document a guideline, feel free to change or ignore anything that doesn’t suit your playing style or campaign. At least the reader has a few more ideas with which to work.

Savage Apocalypse covers PA topics such as hero creation, mutations, environmental hazards, robots, gear, artifact discovery and creatures. Since this a SWEX fan work, there are new hindrances, edges, skills and other goodies.

84809.name: Savage Pendragon
84809.description:
From the introduction:
While Pendragon is a great system, the combat always left me feeling it could be better., somehow it never scaled well for me, and was sometimes TOO deadly. Also, the Mass battle Rules are good, but somewhat more complicated then I like. So here is my conversion to my favorite system. I’ll elaborate the SW battle rules a little as well in this conversion. I’ll always use he and him instead of she and her in this document. Just easier for me. Remember however, that Pendragon is very well suited for female gamers!

To use this document, You need the Pendragon books (I used 3rd edition ) or have very good knowledge of the rules to understand my conversion. Certainly only for all the background therein, you should look into, and buy, the Pendragon line! (I haven't got the newest edition yet, but a friend has. I’ll look into that edition later to see if I can use anything from that for this conversion)

What I didn’t change: Money, all rules regarding the manor (only the skills governing some stuff are now different) Knight Values as measurement for Battle stays as well, and everything Governing Glory gain and loss, although they are only used to indicate your renown, and is no longer used for experience purposes.

84810.name: Takeda
videogamehonor: 2001 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
84810.description:
User summary:

In Takeda, you play the role of legendary Takeda Shingen, a prominent Daimyo in 16th century feudal Japan.

You start out controlling two provinces, Kai and Shinano. Defend against invasion, develop your agriculture and use your resources wisely to build a strong army, all in a real time environment.

During war, control five units and fight tactical battles, in an effort to expand your territories and gain political power.

84811.name: Savaged Redline
84811.description:
From the introduction:
Savaged Redline is based on the Horizon: Redline setting published by Fantasy Flight Games. The setting is described as one that "lets you relive the battles of highway gladiators and post-apocalyptic desperados from film and fiction. It is intended for quick start-up and action packed play." The
savaged version is no different.

This document provides basic background information on the Redline setting. Please note that this is not a direct conversion of the setting. Think of it as a "fast play" set of rules designed to provide a stepping off point for the competent GM. If you require additional information, I highly suggest purchasing Horizon: Redline from Fantasy Flight Games. Redline

84812.name: Scene of the Crime: Criminal Investigation in Savage Worlds
84812.description: User Summary: Web-published material providing ideas and suggestions for handling criminal investigation adventures in the Savage Worlds system.

84813.name: Savage Spells: D&D Spells in Savage Worlds
84813.description:
From the introduction:
What follows is a collection of spells converted from their original form- as presented in the Basic/Expert Dungeons & Dragons (Moldvay/Cook) boxed sets- into Savage Worlds terms.
